Hello, I live at the end of Dewey Street and wanted to seek help with the end of the street. The rain water runs down the street and has washed out the end of my driveway quite severely, and has created a large ditch at the end of the street, near the conservation land.  The snow plows get stuck in this every year, and it is becoming quite large and deep.  I'd like to fix my driveway and put a "lip" at the end to keep the water running smoothly down the street, but was advised to let the town know of the problem that the water is causing and see if it can be fixed.  I also don't want to fix the driveway, and then have it torn up with any roadwork that may be done.  I'd be glad to walk through the problem with anyone.  Please let us know asap if there is any plan to repair the road, as either way, I do need to fix my driveway, as the water runs into the driveway, washing out the end and ultimately under my front porch, which I fear will be washed out, since it gets all of the water from the street.  There is currently a lip in place, which basically just stops.  If this were to be extended, the entire problem would seem to be solved.  If there is a plan to repair this problem, I'll wait on fixing the driveway, otherwise I'll get to work right away, but need to make a decision soon.  I can be reached at 781-233-9175 or 781-520-9360.  Thank you!Shawn Avery43 Dewey St.

Neighbor operating snow blower way past 8pm. I UNDERSTAND that there's a lot of snow on the ground, but common courtesy would dictate not to use (loud) snow blower at 11pm. I get that it's desirable to want to clear out the snow ASAP, but 11pm is unnecessary and rude.
During the winter storms the sidewalk and curb across from my home got ripped up/destroyed by the snow plows.  There are huge chunks falling into the street.

Last winter all of the fire hydrants were covered in snow by the plows.  Towards the end of the season there was a fire truck that had come up to shovel out some of the hydrants.  The one closest to my area was never reached...it was buried in about 20 feet of snow.  Maybe there should be reflectors placed on the hydrants so the plows will know to shovel around it instead of pile the snow on top of it.

Wednesday 26 November 2014 at approx. 6:35 PM: the second of two snow plows working together knocked over (to an angle of approx. 30 degrees above the horizontal) my mailbox and supporting post, which, as a unit, had been installed several years ago according to USPS specifications and has withstood plowing in past conditions with worse visibility.  I would think that any DPW driver operating more than a few times on Hopkinton Road would be aware of the location of this mailbox; the DPW even relocated it when repairing a water main break in front of my property.  From my living room window, I saw the incident as it occurred: I believe that the plow driver was operating at excessive speed for safely plowing the heavy wet slushy snow.  To avoid interruption of my mail delivery, please examine the damage, discuss with me, and effect repair immediately.  Thank you.

How much longer must we endure this horrible paving patch job?  The street was torn up before Thanksgiving and has yet to be repaved.  Every heavy rain storm loosens up the pavement.  Just imagine what the snow and plows will bring? It's illogical to wait until spring.  I expect we'll be re-routed again, as we were during the long weeks of construction before?  This has been a nightmare for all of Hough's Neck!
Street cut up by snow plows. Needs to be filled with topping. Being a street used by school kids it is dangerous. I have seen many kids trip while they walk to school.

This street is congested with cars from folks who use the commuter rail instead of paying to park in the LRTA garage.  Lowell Police will have a super payday during this snow ban if they ticket these cars.  Maybe that will teach them to not park there during snow storms, and make it easier for the residents to leave their driveways without risking their lives to oncoming traffic.

I feel this condition has gone on long enough and should be repaired before winter arrives again.

the many bus stops along sea st are not shoved. this forces riders to wait for bus in the street and poses a hazard for both drivers and pedestrians. this is an issue every snow storm and can't wait for T officials attention.

Every winter I bring up the fact that this stretch of Route 60 is impassible in snow to us pedestrians. But it doesn't seem to be an issue that gets solved. At 8pm tonight, there I was, walking in the street because I had to get home from the train station. I really can't describe how dangerous this is. The only real protection I have is the flashlight attached to my backpack, and the hope that the drivers will be attentive enough to notice me in time. I'm sure there aren't enough resources to keep the sidewalk clear, or there is some turf issue and there will be a claim that this is someone else's responsibility. But meanwhile the situation is really, really dangerous.
snow was not plowed, so deep snow is trapping water from melting snow from reaching the storm drain, causing street flooding.

The people at the northern end of Auburn St continue to leave their "spot savers" since "the blizzard". There is NO snow on the ground but they continue to leave cones. After the blizzard a statement was sent out by the City of Malden that is against the rules to save your spot with a marker after a snow storm. I have been abiding by that statement but people at the end of the street do not. They also said this would be enforced and officials would be going around the city and removing/throwing away any "spot savers." If I am following the rules WE ALL SHOULD :-)

Malden has a lot of pedestrians. Please make the sidewalks safe and accessible to everyone.

1/6/13Why has the DPW not responded to this report? I want a response as to why the DPW failed to plow as well as an explination as to why this report has not been addressed. There is an insufficient amount of lighting on Hammond Street between the Chestnut Hill train stop and Route 9. I have seen people slip at night because they couldn't see the sidewalk properly. Most importantly, as a young woman, I feel in danger walking home alone on this street in the dark, because I have been approached by strange men who I can barely see, and I have felt like I was being followed a few times. I propose that at least 3 more streetlights be added to this section of Hammond Street.

South Cambridge St.  Followup and summary of an ongoing issue. I would like to thank the DPW Administration for acknowledging this issue, as well as our concerns and frustrations. In a recent post a comment was made that in the past S. Cambridge was only graded twice a year and is now graded monthly. Unfortunately times have changed and the bandaid repairs of the past are no longer sufficient for a multitude of reasons given the changes in population and road usage.1. There is no gravel or hardener on this road. Years of repeated blade grading have reduced this road to soft sand which ruts and forms pot holes immediately after grading because of traffic and weather conditions. Furthermore there has never been any crowning of So. Cambridge St. to control runoff during heavy rains and avoid the gullies that form.2. There is a lot of major construction in the surrounding area and very large construction vehicles accelerate the damage. 3. Overall there are more people living in the surrounding area.     a. There are more year round residents.     b. There are more people using their properties in the shoulder season.      c. We are also concerned that emergency vehicle response time is hampered by these nearly impassable roads.4. Some of us have incurred significant damage to our cars. The front end of my car was totaled last winter and was beyond repair. Last year we were told that once the ground freezes that routine maintenance cannot be performed. With partially frozen water in large potholes and a light covering of snow the pot hole become invisible and a menace to car suspensions.It is time for the Town to develop a long term solution.  Repeated band-aids are so temporary that they are useless and not cost effective.  We would like to establish a dialogue between the neighborhood and the DPW, so we can work together to make a long term fix a Town priority.  Who shall we contact to start this process?

January 3-4, 2015Without question some of the worst snow removal I have seen in my 40 years in town. 8:15am the day after the storm, heavy rain falling, nearly 10 hours after the last flake of snow fell and Acton Road still looked like a whiteout version of a 18th century rutted horse cart path. There may have been sand and salt on the road, but I couldn't see it under the 2-3 inches of heavy slushy snow on EVERY road in town. Lack of berms on the sides of the roads are obvious signs not a single plow was deployed on even the main streets. A quick drive to the Billerica, Westford, Acton, Carlisle (yes, Carlisle!!!!) showed bare pavement starting at the town line. One of the lighter winters so far in several years in terms of snowfall and we get our rear ends handed to us by a 2-3 inch snowstorm?? Embarrassing! The rain did more to clear the roads the equipment did (or maybe that was the plan?). The last go round with the icy roads overnight and a slow salt/sand dispatch ended up losing us a fire truck on the taxpayers' dime. Thankfully no one got hurt or killed. WHAT IS GOING ON AT THE HIGHWAY DEPARTMENT????

Please inform the plow team that a small city truck plow should clear excessive snow from cleaned driveways after major plowing. I cannot clean the driveway after each pass of the large plow. I did this twice and can no longer continue. This is a safety issue if I cannot get my car out of the driveway.Years ago, this was NOT the way plowing was done. Please return to the old system of plowing which did not plow in so much snow into driveways.

When the Prime Gas station was permitted by the Planning Board, they (and their attorney) promised to remove snow from the site and not plow it onto the sidewalk.  Well, they have plowed it onto the sidewalk, blocked the sight line south from the corner coming out of Palmer onto Lafayette and made this intersection even more dangerous than it usually is because of all of the unsigned entries and exits at the station.  This should not be allowed and the station should meet their commitment from the Planning Board meetings to remove the snow, especially from a storm such as we all just had.  Pedestrians are now forced out into the street.  Tonight, this will be even more dangerous in the dark.  This site does not have sufficient snow storage for a storm such as this or even a succession of smaller storms and they must be required to remove snow (as they promised) and not store it on public sidewalks.

City of Salem refusing to plow the road our back yard driveway is on.  Decided it's not a road for this storm.  Leaving two houses totally stranded.  At least I can shovel 27 stairs, 3 landings and get to Loring Ave even though I can't get my vehicles out.

Patton Road and streets in general neighborhood are only passable for one car at the moment.  When meeting oncoming traffic you will be lucky not to get stuck in a snow bank.  Patton Road can be widened by at least 4 - 6 ft in total.  I understand that this was an enormous storm and crews are working very hard to make all the roads passable.  Thank you for your consideration.

While the plows have been diligent in coming down Federal and Beckford Streets what they need to do is attempt to move the snow back farther with each pass, not just replow what has already been plowed.  When the parking ban is lifted, all of our cars are going to return to these streets and not enough has been plowed to make the streets wide enough to both park on and drive down them. This is of little help to us. Please instruct plow drivers to now begin widening the streets.

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: Trash wasn’t picked up on Monday, January 26th as it should have been on upper Hillside Ave.  Recycling was picked up but they never returned for the trash collection.  There are trash bags and barrels out there that may get covered in snow only to be plowed down when the plows come by ending up in a big mess.  We just thought you should know.
There are drifts across the entire street and we cannot get our cars out.
The right lane on Bridge Street is still very snowy/icy and is dangerous. Frankly, all of Bridge Street and 114 in Salem need to be treated with salt, they are a mess.
We desperately need salt or sand on Lemon, Smith, and Northey Streets. They are very dangerous right now.
Snow plow keeps plowing pavement. Snow needs to be pushed back 3ft on either side of the street.

Cow path, old type street. No parking either side. Not wide enough to get an emergency vehicle (firetruck) down around corner. Also resident parking area at seawall, at some point, could use widening. The cars that will return to park there when emergency ban is lifted, will make it impassible to due to high plowing of mountains of snow at wall causing loss of  parking space area. Unfortunately loss of reasonable space to park does not stop people from parking there & blocking the road. A widening pass on this seawall area would be helpful & appreciated. Thank you.

Boardman St is the width of one car, if the ban is lifted and cars park on the street the street will become a parking lot. The snowbanks are several feet out from the sidewalks on both sides. Someone needs to come and widen the street or we are going to have cars stuck all over the place like in years past.

As we should, we cleared the sidewalk on the corner of Bridge and Williams three times during the storm. Last night one of the big plows pushed a ton of Bridge Street snow onto the sidewalk up high on our fence. I know you guys are slammed so I'm happy to clear it within reason again since that is our responsibility, but it now needs heavy machinery to even get started.See attached image.

The plow drivers didnt push snow far enough and now the streets worth of snow is mounded infront of and before our drive way. My Wife has a rare disease that at any point we may need to get out or have emergency vehicles and neither can happen.  will most likely need a front end loader or bobcat.
Hayes/McKinley Road need to be plowed one more time.
Cars are having an issue turning onto Balcomb st from Symonds st due to slippery incline
Looking for a couple of passes on West Terrace as soon as possible. Elderly residents needing to get out.

We need a plow to run through a couple of times. If we stop to see if Cars are coming on Boston street them we get stuck. So we have to roll through the stop and pray there are no Cars coming so we can get through. Just a couple of runs through to get rid or that extra snow at the end of the street would be awesome.

I know you are very busy, this is a reminder that our street has not been touched and we have a couple of elderly people who live back here and emergency vehicles would not be able to access their house. Thank you!
We need a plow to run up and down the hill a couple times w the plow and  put down some salt.  Thank you!

I spoke with the post office and the will not deliver our mail even though I shoveled a path to the mailbox. There is no where to shovel this snow other than into the middle of the street. Can a plow please push this away?  chris 617-388-6278

My request is for those jumbo sized DO NOT ENTER- WRONG WAY signs for the ramps to route 495 when approaching on Route 110.  I've seen them in other locations and think this is a necessary place for them.I work on Route 110 at 227 Chelmsford St.   I live south and come onto Route 110 from 495 northbound.  A couple of weeks ago as I was on the ramp approaching route 110 coming down the ramp from 495, I encountered a truck head on going up the ramp in the wrong direction!   Fortunately he spotted me in time and could quickly swerve onto the grass separator strip and he could connect to his intended ramp (without tipping over too).   If this had been after the blizzard with 5'' frozen snow banks, goodness knows what might have happened.Since that occurrence, I cringe every day coming off 495 to 110.  Sometimes if I have time, I skip 495 and take the route 110 all the way from Littleton  to avoid the ramp.Please do something so this cannot happen again.

single lane down the middle of the street without snow being pushed back to the sides and making it difficult for the children to walk to bus stops at 6th Ave and Needham, and Needham and Groton Road. I tried to clear the fire hydrant, but it is next to snow piled high in the intersection. Far too high and dense for my snowblower this time.

It's a definite safety issue with all of the inexperienced drivers coming and going from CHS.   Thank you in advance, and for your hard work during this storm.

The snow plow pushed the snow up on the sidewalks on Mill Street  and they are completely snow covered and you have to walk out in the street to get to the Holbrook/Randolph Commuter Rail....this is very dangerous...could you please have someone address this issue before someone gets hurt.....thank you

There are no sidewalks plowed on Pond Street and Reed Street. There are children that walk to Donovan school and to the T bus stop on North Main. Since there are no school buses, kids cannot be expected to walk in the streets to get to school. One person got hit by a car several years ago when this happened with a lot of snow before.

There is a six foot mound of snow at this location where kids need to stand to wait for the bus to Norfolk County Agricultural High. There is nowhere for them to stand for bus and kids cannot stand in the street to wait for bus. They have school tomorrow and this needs to be addressed asap.

Rear exit/entrance to door is completely blocked by snow.  Stairs unshoveld.  If there was a FIRE or an EMERGENCY, exiting the building would be hazardous. They have a sign posted that says be careful slippery, however not possible to exit.

Sidewalk on Beach st by Dental Lab believe it borders on private property.  Who is responsible for clearing a path on this sidewalk.  Deep snow dumps out on the corner of Mill St & Beach.  Someone whether it be the business there or private property needs to take care of this, so pedestrians don't have to walk in the street.  Beach St is very busy and some poor pedestrian is going to get killed just trying to walk in that area.

Aren't private properties supposed to shovel their sidewalks?  Seeing tons of people just not making an effort to shovel or remove snow at all.  Does the city give out tickets/citations to properties that don't comply with shoveling/removal of snow?

When City gets a plan in place to actually remove some of the snow on the streets, please put the corner of Eaton & Beach St on the list.  Very dangerous.  Can't see traffic coming down Beach or pedestrians trying to cross at Eaton.  Could be a potential mva or worse.

Hoping the DPW plows could take another trip down Longwood Road. all drives going to salem state are cleared. this has 5' drifts

The plows did a great job during the blizzard going up and down Hardy Street between Derby and Essex.  However, now that the storm has passed there is still a significant amount of snow on the street.  One or two plow runs down the street should fix this.  Please help.  Thank You.

When this station was permitted by the Planning Board a little over a year ago, it and its attorney committed to remove snow from site and not store it on the sidewalk.The snow is now stored on the public sidewalk forcing pedestrians to walk either into the gas station or out on the street.The station does not have sufficient snow storage on site and must remove it so that pedestrians are not at risk walking through the busy station or out in the street.

The parking lot situation in front of Bank of America, Starbucks, et. al is unbelievable.  The handicapped spots are full of snow and almost none of the lot has been properly plowed or plowed at all.  The store owners have shoveled their sidewalks but the city has failed to make the parking lot itself safe.  It is unusable for many metered spaces.

Still pikes of snow in parking lots and roads.

3-4' icicles, on power lines, overhanging sidewalk.

no curb to curb plowing or even close.  On even side of street, snowbank 3+ ft from curb more in some places.  This desperately needs to be widened.

I understand the City is extremely busy, but wanted to bring this area to your attention.  Thank you.

James K came on January 30th and did a wonderful job of clearing  out my car but alas it is now buried again. I am a senior citizen and a widow whose husband always did all the shoveling. I have many health challenges most recently I had shoulder surgery. Shoveling will never be possible for me so I will always be relying on the Snowcrew to "rescue" me and believe me it is truly "rescuing" that they do. Without the snow crew I would be house bound until the spring thaw. Thanks again, with deep gratitude, for the wonderful work you have done in the past for me and happily continue to do for me.

I've seen 2 fender benders in last 4 days because Leach Street is so narrow & such a mess. Please rectify the situation & plow curb to curb all way down to Dead End which will allow room for cars to park & traffic to safely pass. Secondly, can you please send down heavy equipment & a truck to remove large snow pile at end of Street, that's only place we have for plow trucks to put the snow & it's overflowing into Street & driveways. Please see attached picture. I live on the Dead End part of Leach Street & I was out snowblowing the majority of the storm. Unfortunately during the entire storm only 2 plows came down the street & they made a mess of the Street. The 1st hack started to plow & then got stuck for over 25 minutes. He then decided to make 1 pass down the middle leaving snow at least 5 feet away from each curb. He proceeded to leave until I stopped to ask how come he isn't plowing curb to curb like most other city streets & his response was "That's not my job, I have other Streets to plow". It wasn't until 4 phone calls later from neighbors they sent down the big escavator but they did Glover Street & not our Dead End because the operator said there's no place else to put snow.Any help you can provide on this already narrow road is much appreciated.

deep snow on street, probably caused by people shoveling.    Road was difficult to drive, even for my four wheel drive vehicle.   Road so narrow due to parked cars that my car was bushing against the snowbank on the side of the street.

At the intersection of English and Essex the snow piles are so high and with people parking on both sides of the street, we are forced to take a risk an pull right out into traffic and not able to see if there is traffic coming. There is no room to turn safely. Is there any way to take the snow away from that corner so we can safely turn? I was almost hit there on Sunday when a car came whipping around the corner from Essex to English.

Unable to even reach the buttons for the crosswalk on both sides of North Street at Federal/North Street junction, North Street is very busy and it's scary trying to cross with no crosswalk, especially at night.  If you do make it across the street the sidewalks are not clear on either side.

The entrance to Carlton Street from Derby street requires snow removal.  The snow is so deep cars are fishtailing into the right snowbank or getting stuck when they take the corner.

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: Te scheduled 2/2 Monday trash pickup was not done because of the snow storm.  Trash was not picked up Tuesday 2/3 either.
We were just told by police that we are no longer able to park on either side of Holly St. because it is too narrow. Please send plow trucks to widen it.

He piled his trash barrels on the sidewalk where he plowed - this occurred after 4:00pm and the trash was collected around noon today. This snow plowing mess is an ongoing problem with the owner of this property.

I would like To recommend that Conant St be checked for parking restrictions.  The street has been narrowed so much that you can just barely get one car down the road at a time.  Also the city said that it was going to be removing some of the snow banks last storm.  The snow banks on Conant St. Are 8-10 ft high along the street and there is no room for any more snow if more storms come.

Hi There! I'd like to request that our street (Pickman at Winter st) be re-plowed. There's several inches of snow that are causing cars to get stuck and/or spin out as the try to drive down it. Please prioritize public walks in downtown. Riley Plaza crossing and  New Derby St. give access to Post Office, bus stops and City Hall. Steve's Market is a major food source.

For multiple winters now, this building has been allowed to have massive and very dangerous icicles form on the utility lines. It is due to no downspout on the gutters. An easy fix. The icicles cause the sidewalk to shut down, and people have to enter traffic to go around the icicles. The city needs to contact the landlord about this issue ASAP.
Looking to pay for someone to snow blow and shovel for two residence around homes.

The front loader was down the street to plow it last night the issue is that he just plied it up on the sidewalks and end of driveways so that if we clear our driveway we still can't see past the snow pile that he put there.  The snow has to be removed or banked down somehow before folks can clear the sidewalks.
The turn from Canal to Broadway at the McDonald's entrance is un-passable for regular autos. There are businesses back there. Please clean this area up. Thank you.

There is so much car traffic in this area between Congress to the post office and the snow is in huge ruts everywhere. This should be a place where the snow is removed rather than plowed. Just a suggestion.  Thanks for all you do.

Several plows came yesterday morning to early afternoon but none since then and we, my neighbor and I can't have our door-ways and driveway done until the street is done and as it is now I doubt that fire department, Ambulance, Mail, Trash, could respond to us.Your assistance in this matter would be greatly appreciated since my neighbor is still trying to get visiting nurses in to help her. Thank you in advanceNancy Bertini
A truck came by around noon on Monday. We were not plowed last storm either for 2 days.
Our street hasn't been touched since yesterday morning.  What they did push up once again is sitting at end of driveway.  Last storm a random plow guy moved our snow not the city of Salem.
Allen st is effectively blocked at both ends due to plowing. Snow in the street itself is approx. 3+ inches deep.

I am disabled and need assistance with shoveling and clearing my handicap parking space.I have tried to keep up with it but I am having difficulty.Is there low cost or any services available to assist me in clearing the snow?

Hersam St. has been reduced a width of a little over one car. It is a two-way street. The plow driver we had last winter was amazing. Please put him back on the route. That way we will be able to actually get in a out of our driveways. I realize there is a lot of snow but that is no excuse for poor plowing.

my siblings adult day bus can not make it down to our street, they're unable to make the turn from pky onto Lewis and Lewis onto Paris street.  if they can't make the turns I don't see how a Fire Truck would be able to get into this neighborhood.  This pix was taken late am today 2-3-15.  Also Baily street sidewalks not shoveled there is no where to put the snow. The small pickup truck plowing is not big enough for this neighborhood.

Hi, could you please send a plow to Cedar Terrace. The cars are getting stuck. Thank you.

Hi, there is a fire hydrant with empty snow-filled parking spaces on either side of the hydrant that have 4+ feet of snow.  Can the hydrant and the spaces be cleared with a plow for access to the hydrant and more parking for residents?  Thank you.

Please send a city truck up to the top section of Wallace Street.  As happens every year, you can barely get through up here with one car . Also, the hills (Tremont and Leonard streets)  leading up here are treacherous and very slippery.  Please put some sand and/or salt down before tomorrow's  additional snow.

There is a Green Car with California plates on Appleton Street that has not shoveled out in the past two storms.  More snow is coming.  Is it possible to have it ticketed or have it towed?  There are others that would  be more than happy to shovel out the spot and put there car there.
Trash not picket up. Been out since 5am on sidewalk not blocked by any snow at all
Sidewalks haven't been shoveled in front of the church at the intersection of Salem & Pierce.

After Juno, a great path was cut for pedestrians to cross Main St at the intersection with Salem St.  When you get a chance, a repeat performance would be very helpful to the many pedestrians who cross there between the corner church and the ILC.

The sidewalk on the north side of Winter St between Main St and Banks Pl is completely blocked by sidewalks at each intersecting street. This forces commuters on their way to Oak Grove to walk on Winter St, which disrupts traffic on Winter St because the street is not wide enough for cars to pass with pedestrians on the street.

Half the sidewalks along Savin Street are completely unshoveled and it appears that they were never shoveled after the last storm. This is outrageous, especially since people are walking along this street to get to their doctor's office. Please send an inspector out here!
Sidewalk at the corner of Cedar not clear
Reported business owner "The Electricians & Company, Inc."  plowing snow into the Salemwood parking lot for their private snow removal.
I understand this is under the Cemetery dept, and its completely full of snow.  Not sure they can get to it, but it is a reoccurring theme

Please clear onramps at all four corners. Plowing has piled snow onto them and frozen and making them hazardous. There is no safe way for wheel chairs and baby carriages to access the sidewalks at this intersection. It's a shame since the sidewalks leading in to the intersection are well maintained. I had to lift the baby stroller over the snow with cars whizzing past. This is a dangerous spot, and can be rectified easily with a shovel + salt.
Please widen Pine Street in between the Fellsway North and South.  It is a two way road, with only room for one car.  Just the small portion between Fellsway North and South

Not enough room for two way traffic.

There is a very, very tall snowpile at the corner of Main and Holm. It is so high that cars exiting the doctor's office at 578 Main and cars exiting Holm Court cannot see the road when they try to make a left. It doesn't matter if you back up a bit -- you still can't see, making those turns extremely dangerous. Please have someone remove enough of the snow so that  drivers can see the road and make these turns safely.
No sand/salt after two last storms. Plowing has been excellent, but afterwards street is slick.
Cannot cross street nor get on sidewalk. Walking kids to school. Must walk in street

Most sidewalk corners at this major intersection look terrific just 1 needs work... southeast corner. Several big boulders of snow right in walkpath. Thank you!! :)

Please plow  John Street, Larkin, James and Highland ave.  Specifically, there is no visibility at intersections.  Bottom of John @ Highland Ave is a few inches deep on an already narrow road.   I know everyone is working hard, but a dusting tomorrow will make John street impossible.  Thank you
Highland Ave needs to be wider, especially the hill.  The neighborhood off of Highland (John/James/Larkin Ave need to be cleaned up at corners.  Thank you.

Contractor using a front end loader to pick up and dump the snow from the parking lot into the culvert, which feeds into Beaver Brook, which I believe is our drinking water supply.  Not sure thee folks should be dumping snow into culvert, which typically runs all year long.

hello. You're doing a wonderful job on the roads with all the snow. I have a request. Can you please push back the snow in front of the Kensington apartments up to the next apartment complex. I get dropped off by the inbound LRTA #15 bus and need the button to safely cross Billerica Roda.
Miacomet ave from Octoki to end has not seen a plow since snow storm

trash collector skipped pick up at this residence. Might have missed due to Very high snow bank.
Plow dumped snow pile on sidewalk impossible to move.

Properzi Way & Eliot St still have a several inch deep line of snow/slush down the middle of each street. issue_type: Snow- Request DPW to Shovel Public Property
issue_description: Our street was never plowed completely after last week's storm, or Monday's. Slush and packed snow, several inches deep in most places. It's very slushy now, and is going to freeze once the sun goes down. I don't care that we can't use our sidewalk, but walking down the street (never mind driving) is becoming dangerous.
As is the case every year Monroe Muffler does not clear the sidewalks to the side and in front of their property.
The sidewalk in front of this property is barely touched. I almost fell twice trying to get through.

Over the past few years of bike commuting to Somerville, I have come to expect that the community path is treated as a "main road" and well cleared. It was very disappointing to find an inch or two of slush over the entire path this morning, which made for very unsafe biking conditions. Please consider bikes vehicles that need safe routes after storms. Because I biked today, there was one less car on the road and an extra parking spot at Winter Hill school, where I work. If safe routes were available, even more people would choose to bike.

There is a large pot hole between 23 & 25 Clark Street. This pot hole is by the man hole of the sewer and has been made worse by the snow plow. The asphalt pieces needs to be picked up and refilled. This will cause damage to cars and to citizens how walk as there are no sidewalks on this street.

The sidewalks in the back of the school are still impassable. I understand this isn't the town's responsiblity, however, under MA State law you do have the ability to fine homeowners for not clearing a walkable path. Please ensure children have a safe walking path to and from school.
The plows have completed covered the DPW barrel of sand located on the corner of Staaf and Essex (near the bus stop).
Completely not shoveled. This is the case year after year. Please cite the management company.
Sidewalk on arborway from DPW to the corner of Washington still has not been cleared. Walking is difficult and slippery.

Sidewalk in front of electrical depot has not been shoveled at all. Sidewalks in the general area have not been shoveled to ADA standards. Some places have cleared barely a foot wide. Please send ISD to do some enforcement.

The sidewalk in front of Boloco and other shops on Charles St at Boylston is full of snow and hasn't been shoveled. It is slick and slippery and very dangerous for commuters walking to work. Doesn't Boston have a snow removal policy for businesses? Which business is responsible for that corner? Should be held accountable.

Entrance to crosswalk has not been cleared. The crosswalk by haymarket station is blocked by 3-4 feet of snow, forcing pedestrians to walk in the path of mbta buses - obviously very dangerous. Please have the crosswalk cleared.

Snow completely blocks sidewalk so no way to continue on Revere Beach Parkway without walking in street (this is next to a school). After last snow, they dug out the Union Street side to just around the corner where it stopped dead and pedestrians had to just turn around, walk back and go in the street as the snow bank it dead-ended into was impossible to scale safely.

Metro Credit Union Sidewalk not cleared. Pedestrians have to detour through their parking lot. They dump snow onto sidewalk from lot. The break is okay now, but have watched them dump snow between drive and the sidewalk cleared by McDonalds making that sidewalk unusable.
Sidewalk not cleared. Pedestrians forced to walk on Route 16.
Sidewalk not cleared. Pedestrians forced to walk on Route 16.
Sidewalk is not cleared. Pedestrians forced to walk on Route 16.

issue_type: Snow - Plowed snow mound blocking sidewalk or corner
issue_description: Hi- It was extremely treacherous walking my child to Cabot School this morning because not even a small path was shoveled from East Side Pkwy through field to the school entrance, causing us to fall numerous times in snow to our waists and making a normally 2 minute route over 30 min. Once finally across, the crosswalk had an enormous snow mound, easily 12 feet that we had to climb over to access the crosswalk in order to access the school entrance. There was literally no other way to enter the school.If school was on today, then the access to it should have been available. This was unacceptable, dangerous, and quite exhausting. I can't imagine what a person with mobility limitations would have done. I could barely manage myself.Please remedy ASAP for all Cabot families. Thank you.

My usual snow-clearing guy will be out of town.  I can do my walkway, but I can't use the snowblower to use the driveway and sidewalk.  You are welcome to use it, and my shovels and whatever else you need.  I'll make you hot cocoa.#snowcrew

Remove snow in center island at South Court cul-de-sac - vehicle visibility issue.
Remove snow piled at corner of South court 2@ South St. - vehicle visibility problem.
Snow piles very high at corner; difficulty getting out of the street onto Hunting Road. Could some of the snow be removed?

Remove snow from sidewalk between 617 Central and Cefalo Rd. Bus stop at Central and Cefalo is non-existent due to no sidewalk. Kids stand in street on Cefalo and my kids stand in our driveway (as walking on Central to get to bus stop is too dangerous).

The snow plowers placed all of the snow onto a resident property.  Its causing problems when driving up to the top due to the snow bank being there. Will someone be removing that snow because its going to cause some issues with the main street and

Hazard to shoppers as they are leaving the s th store. . It's already overhanging where the elderly wait for their rides... Large amounts of snow are overhanging the whole length of the stores from shaws to Eastern Bank..

Exiting Stone St in North Revere onto Salem Street. Snow on left side of Stone (left side when exiting the street) is piled so high that you have to be in the travel lane to exit the street at which point you are in danger of being hit by the vehicles traveling in that lane. Snow removal crews did come but they took the snow from the right side and added it to the already dangerously high left side. I know you guys are completely overwhelmed and exhausted from these 2 storms I work for MassDOT doing the same thing and am very sorry to but in a report on this but it is scary coming out of the street and we have small kids in the car. Anything you can do will be appreciated.

There is also a Bus stop right there where there is no longer any place to stand. It's been over 2 weeks and this issue needs to be fixed. Thank you

Storm drain in  front of my driveway appears to be caving in. I know you're busy with snow right now but I would appreciate it if someone could at least take a look at it. I don/t want to end up with my cars wheel stuck in it..  Thanks in advance for anything you can do.
Snow piled from city plows cause a traffic concerns cars turning onto winn street from shields cannot see oncoming traffic
The sidewalk along Bedford Road by the power lines are not clear of snow. People are having to walk in the street in order to get anywhere.

Street isn't really plowed, people continually get stuck on the hill.  Street is very narrow due to snow piles

During Snow storm- plows placed all snow from street in front of sewer drain which is located on side of our driveaway.  Because the drain is covered with snow the street on our corner ( near our driveay and our neighbors ) is flooding.  Our neighbor called the city on Monday and told this would be taken care of yesterday.   We just got home from work and nothing has been done yet.  Thanks for your time

This street is so icy that bus drivers are being told not to attempt to come down it so they won't get stuck.  I have a handicap teenager that I had to walk to the corner of Sycamore a Street with to get on her bus.  Road is icy and snow covered .  She has difficulty with, balance, gait, etc.  road conditions put us in a position to potentially cause physical harm to both of us.

The East Side of Main Street from 1117 Main Street to Forest Glen Rd. need to have sidewalks plowed and intersections at Willard Rd., Irving and Forest Glen cleared so that High School and Coolidge Middle School  children from this neighborhood can get back to walking to and from school. Going to school, they cross over at Forest Glen from East side of Main, walk down Forest to Whittier Rd. Or if rest of Main Street on East side is passable they could walk down Main to Birch Meadow. However, parts of that are not passable also. Thank you so much.

Please enforce the resident to maintain the sidewalk so the children can safely get to their parents cars at school pick up. We are forced to walk on the busy street. This is an issue with every snowfall, not just this winter. If we don't enforce the residents to shovel can the town take care of this?  Thanks for all your hard work in these last two weeks!
Snow is still 10-15 feet from my curbside where my mailbox is. I need to make a path but if you could get it a little closer to curb it would be appreciated.

Hi I live at 111 Main Street in South Grafton and the guy who lives across the street from me at 112 Main street white apt. building..  works for a landscaping company who plowed their driveway and lives there, at midnight during the storm and plowed from their driveway and yard into the main street , onto our sidewalk across the street and into my front yard at 111 Main Street, I saw that the town workers were trying to clean all that snow out today 2-4-15  that  the plow truck guy had piled up on their sidewalk  etc, and the town backhoe put it back into their yard out back The name of the company is "Evergreen landscaping" its a dark green truck F350 dual rear tires and a dump body with sander on it. and a plow of course.. Just thought Id let you know about this for the backhoe had to spend quite some time on that project today whereas if the guy just put the snow in his own yard it wouldnt been alot easier and more fair. For I have enuf snow in my own yard, Thanks for your attention to this matter.  111 Main Street South GRafton, MA. 508-887-8870

Curtis Street, and the small street that connects between Curtis and Orange desperately needs attention. Too dark to take a photo this evening, but the snow is still very high in the middle and at the street entrance, scraping beneath car and causing very slippery conditions. Very difficult to get out of driveways. If more snow is coming, this needs to be cleared. Please help.

There is about 2 feet deep of snow on the bike path/ pedestrian walkway that runs parallel to the bypass. The entrances to the path from the streets (Lemon, Saunders, etc) are also block with snow, waist deep in some places. Hope this area can go on the list for snow removal. Thanks.
Snow plows have blocked the crosswalk and there is no clear path for children to access sidewalk unless they walk in the street.
pedestrians can not access button on traffic light to safely cross street

There are cross walks blocked and stretches of side walks in front of residences that are not shoveled causing people to walk in already narrow streets. With Bentley School down the street is makes it difficult for children who walk to school.

At Curtis and Essex St. There is a ton of snow not plowed and people are getting stuck...there is a bit of a dip in the pavement which makes it worse.

Children are forced to walk in the street or climb a large snow pile in order to walk to Saltonstal School.

Because the snow banks are so far out into the street, different trucks have not been able to pull my car out of the driveway to get to the service station. The fire exits for my daughter's preschool classroom at Bentley's ECC program are blocked with 6 foot drifts. This area, between the playground and the building, has not been cleared at all. issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste

for as long as I have lived on pleasant st (25+ years)   #26-28 has never cleared the sidewalk any winter. 22-24 Pleasant began plowing in front of their property only last year but they plow it to the sides causing huge mounds and still blocking the sidewalks. Leavitt Street from Congress St. to the back entrance of Shetland Park is a mess with poor snow removal. It is down to one way without any cars parked on the side of the road. With all the traffic going to Salem District Court at Shetland, it is extremely difficult to maneuver. Please plow and widen the snowbanks. Thank you.

The neighborhood of Piedmont, Roslyn and Hancock streets needs some serious plowing attention.  In the "plowed" lane, snow is quite deep in spots making it hard to keep traction and control.  The corners also have incredibly high snow banks and narrow turning radius making it virtually impossible for cars to pass, especially if a car is coming in the other direction (only Roslyn is actually a one way).  Many residents rely on street parking, which is also hard to come by  - streets are barely wide enough to drive down - they are definitely not plowed "curb to curb".  I understand there is a lot of snow that needs to be removed across the city, but this area is in desperate need of some help.  Thank you!

Leach St is restricting moving cars to pass parked cars safely because of the snow left on the street and the inability to plow closer to the sidewalk on the odd side of the street. Also I highly doubt an ambulance or firetruck can get by at night when everyone comes home and parks haphazardly.

The City plowed a small section of the sidewalk on the odd side of Essex, by Warren St last night (but not the longer stretch just after the Fire Station). However, the kids going to the Middle School generally walk on the other side (the even) to go to CVS first and use the cross walk on the even side. It would make more sense to plow the side the kids actually use. Also, CVS is notoriously slow to clear their sidewalk so a firm reminder to them would be useful as well.
I'm 5'6" and had to crawl across the snow banking just to reach the crosswalk button ... And the button is apparently broken too.

The sidewalk in front of this house has not been cleared since the Blizzard! It's completely impassable, forcing us to walk in the street on a somewhat blind corner. We cannot gain clear sidewalk access all the way down to the intersection if the Bypass and Bridge St. We are forced to walk in the street the entire way. It's very dangerous!

The sidewalk by the hill on Puritan Rd on the corner of Ord St needs to be cleared of snow. Children had to walk in the street this morning  on their way to school. As the street is already narrow and busy during school pick up an drop off, this is a dangerous situation.

It is impossible to see over the corner snowbanks when turning out of side streets onto Bridge, and many sections of the sidewalks aren't shoveled due to the giant snowbanks. People are walking in the road and it's really dangerous. Will you please remove the snowbanks on Bridge Street like you do on Essex and Washington?
Please ticket 40-42 Northey.  They did not shovel at all on the sidewalk.
Dropped off at carlton sch. This morning.  Lots of snow still in street.  A plow going through before parents pick up at 2pm would be so helpful.
There is snow build up on the street. My tires are spinning and I am sometimes getting stuck pulling into my driveway. The street has not been cleared since the last snow fall.

This is a two way driveway and there is no sidewalk to walk on. This is the Salem heights apartments rear exit and entrance. Have to walk in narrow street with cars coming at you both ways and with curves many cars are blind to see you until on top of you no shoveling or treatment on this steep walkway

The sidewalk in front of the cvs,Salem bank,advanced auto is not cleared or treated it is blocking both a crosswalk and bus stop. Have to walk in the street and as you know Essex/107 is very busy and is dangerous to walk or stand in.   People are standing in Essex/107 waiting for bus and in the entrance to the strip mall

Street is dangerously narrow after poor snow removal.  Concerned that the Brook House doesn't have proper access to emergency vehicles for residents. Entire street could use another pass.   Very dangerous at the end of the street, onto Derby, where large piles of poorly plowed snow create icing and make braking very difficult down a small hill. This street is used as a cut through by Essex St. residents, so traffic is frequent and at too high a speed for the very poor conditions.

Large amounts of snow on Curtis Street, especially at the top of the street (Essex St intersection). Street is very compact & narrow, so residents have been shoveling snow out into the street. Multiple cars today have gotten stuck at both intersections of Curtis (Essex & Orange). It makes exiting Curtis onto Essex difficult and dangerous. Thank you.

Snow plowed over sidewalks covering light pole blocking walk buttons on both sides of Boston street.  Can not get to crosswalk so have to take chance crossing this busy street outside crosswalk or walk in street to get to crosswalk very dangerous
Street needs to be plowed

Hello,I am a resident of Everett and live at 59 Hillside Avenue.  I am blind and travel with my seeing-eye dog.  I am a counselor at Mass Rehab in Malden and take the 104 bus every day, which picks me up at the corner of Broadway and Reed Ave.  Since the blizzard last week, it has been impossible for me to get to the bus stop because of snow banks blocking the sidewalks and residents have not cleared their portion of the sidewalk. Not to mention, the bus stop has a huge snow bank, so even if I could get to the bus, I would have to stand in the street to wait for the bus, which I refuse to do.  This has been extremely frustrating. I have missed a lot of work over the past week because I am not able to get there safely.Can someone at Everett City Hall let me know what options there are for disabled residents who use public transit?  My recollection is that residents who do not clear their portion of the sidewalks can be fined by the city.  Is Everett enforcing this law?I would appreciate if someone could please contact me at 781.799.0996 or Stephen.giannaros@mrc.state.ma.us so hopefully we can figure out an alternative solution before I seek further action.Sincerely,Steve Giannaros

The snow banks cover a significant portion of this accident prone street. Would be nice if it could be widened since it's a high traffic route connecting Main st and Ferry St with bus line going through it as well. There's also huge need for some parking since many people on side streets are using "space savers".
as a pedestrian it is hard to walk on sidewalk and no exit to street. Had to go back around. Slippery. Wasn't sanded
73 Suffolk St. is blocking the sidewalk with snow. Not the first time.
Turning left onto Linden Ave. from Florence St. is very dangerous.  There is a huge mound of snow which makes it difficult to see oncoming cars.  Almost got hit on my way home tonight!
Street has a lot of snow, really hard to get in our driveways with that much snow on the streets
Corner lot. Two storms and the sidewalks haven't been touched. Did find time to clear off the boat in the driveway, though. A fine is called for.
sidewalk not shoveled at critical and dangerous intersection. happens every winter. this is a key route for pedestrians including myself.

I reported this address earlier for not clearing sidewalk. It was closed saying sidewalk was clear. I have attached a picture of the still snow covered sidewalk on the Everett Street side of the property. As the owner of a corner lot myself I was under the impression that I need to clear all sidewalks that border my property. Is that not the case? If it is the rule then why is this property owner not held responsible for also? This is a VERY pedestrian heavy street and is impassible by car when people can not get to the sidewalks. This is a very dangerous situation.
Ceader st repeat offenders not clearing sidewalks!
No snow plow or road treatment at all on Maurice st or adjoining roads today. Very icy going down the hills and narrowly avoided an accident. Please treat the roads before this freezes completely!

After not shoveling their sidewalk at all after the last storm, Stop & Shop now refuses to shovel out curb cuts, making it difficult for all residents -- especially those with mobility issues -- to use crosswalk at Jackson and Centre Streets. They also haven't shoveled curbs cuts on Middlesex Street side. Please address with them.
On the corner of Rutland and Bowers, the house hasn't shoveled the sidewalk on the Rutland St. side.

Not sure what happened to my previous description but the situation on Holden St is a hot mess! Parking can not be allowed on both sides of the street with the snow banks taking 1/4 of the street. In addition to the snow banks and parking on both sides, people are double parking! Since the street is barely big enough to let 1 car down when people are parked like this traffic was at a stand still for a good amount of time. This is extremely dangerous and a safety concern especially if the fire trucks need to get down the street to help someone!!

Is there any way that a plow can carve out some of the parking spots on the street overnight, when few people park on this stretch of road? People are parking next to the giant snowbanks, making it hard for traffic to get by. I realize that there isn't a place to put the snow, but even if some of these spots were opened up, it would be a great help to traffic.
Sidewalks buried in snow on this corner property.

Pub is closed and snow has piled up. In addition, the always-ignored municipal lot across the street was never plowed after the most recent storm and it is very difficult to get in and out. Furthermore, people are saving spaces with chairs.
Sidewalk inadequately shoveled as of 9 am today.
sidewalk is not shoveled at all

The first house on Clement next to the Elks has not cleared any snow from their property or sidewalks from either storm. The house is set back at the end of a driveway. Very deep snow leading to house. Looks like a dangerous situation if there was ever a fire or emergency. Sidewalks are impassible also. Very tough to get by over there. No sidewalks clear at surrounding homes either.
The Lincoln Apartments need to make an access path to the street so kids walking to school do not need to walk in the street
Just received a call that Alcott park is in need of plowing (slushy stuff) and sanding.  Thank you

I saw a family walking in the street on their way to school with small children because nobody shoveled the sidewalk. I also walk my children to school. Does anyone enforce this? Should I call someone else to complain? This is the second time I've used this app..
not shovered

Most of the sidewalk on the north side of Florence Street from the Elks lodge to Main Street has not been cleared, forcing pedestrians to walk in street. If property owners won't/can't clear sidewalks the city has to go in with bobcats, front-end loaders or whatever. Extremely dangerous especially in nighttime hours!
Not shoveled. Property looks abandoned. House next to it at 20-22 Spring Street not adequately shoveled, either.
Business cleared the walkway so students can walk on Ferry St sidewalk until they get to the bike trail.  Trail is cleared but crosswalks not?

This is probably a mix of public and private sidewalks, but the entire eastbound sidewalk of Lynn st from revere st to linden sq has not been cleared yet this year. This has also been a chronic problem going back at least the 4 years I've lived here and only seemed to get taken care of when a complaint is filed.

This house has not fulfilled it's obligation to remove snow.  They have a large snow mound preventing passage between 79 Appleton St and 85 Appleton St.  In order for children to walk to school & adults to walk to the bus stops, there has to be clear passage all the way down the street on the sidewalks.  We have a city ordinance for a reason.

The sidewalk has become an ice rink. The drainage from this building just accumulates. They have never salted, or shoveled the snow. Pure sheet of ice. Watched a young child, going to the Chevrus School with his mom, slip and fall this morning

The corner of Ferry and Center street, Chevrus School side: the sidewalk has never been plowed. It is a 15 foot section of 5 foot high snow. Pedestrians, school children going to Chevrus have to walk in the street.  Is this city property or the school? Either way it needs to be managed before someone is run down by a vehicle
The islands at the intersection of Glenwood and Summer Street are piled with snow, blocking the crosswalks and forcing pedestrians to walk around them into traffic. Can they be cleared?

Maple St at the corner of Dexter is a traffic mess due to the lack of plowing the full width of the road. Cars are legally parked here, which prohibits traffic from flowing. It's a complete mess during the morning commute.
Still have to walk in street taking kids to school  339 pleasant st empty nobody cleared sidewalk
Just watched guy put snow on car so he could park illegally. . Nh plates
King Gas not clearing sidewalk

The snow banks on the corner of Brian Road and Rt 4 are too high (over 8"), there is absolutely no visibility onto traffic driving on Rt 4 when you turn out onto the street.  Extremely dangerous since traffic is going over 40 mph.  Please shave down the banks and ask whoever plows this corner  to be mindful of this line of sight obstruction.  We had the same problem last year but did not know how to report it. So glad to find this site! Thanks for your help.

the cross walk light is covered with snow, if you walk from 297 to 300 billerica rd it is very danger if someone is trying to use the cross walk on that corner of elliot and 129( billerica rd)  the one coming accross from 300 billerica is cleaned but not the one from 297 billerica to 300 billerica
Who sends a sander out to salt and sand an unplowed road when temperature will be 10 or` lower this pm.  11am

Kudos to the plow drivers on Vincent , great job!However, at the intersections of Vincent/Mill and Mill/Turnpike there are extremely high snow banks. These intersections are hazardous in good weather with traffic at much higher speeds than the 30 mph posted. Currently there is zero visibility at both insections onto Mill Rd. which has a huge impact on safety.  The front loader was in the area yesterday but these snow banks apparently weren't addressed.  Hopefully  this situation can be remedied before there is a serious accident.Thanks,Arlen & Lynn O'Lari

There was work on Kensington Drive  and the surrounding streets yesterday (2/4/15) to widen the road.  While I understand the need for this and the difficulty involved, I would appreciate if the person driving the big plow could be more considerate of the property markers.  I had four fluorescent markers in front of my house and two of the four were broken by the plow driver yesterday.
School buses having difficulty getting up hill. Needs to be plowed by 8:00 am!!!

Good Morning.  First I would like to thank the DPW for doing such a great job clearing the all the snow in the past week.  Long hours, little praise.  Would it be possible to get snow removal at the corner of Turnpike & Mill Road ?  You can not see in either direction and it is an accident just waiting to happen.  Thank you!
Snow piled so high from clearing fire station I can't see the road to back out of driveway. When the side walk is clear I can see traffic and back out safely. Thank You

It has been several days since the last snow storm on Monday and the sidewalks have not been cleared/cleaned along Lincoln street. This is becoming quite the hazard as people are walking in the street and cars are  not slowing down. I am not sure why Lincoln street is not given priority with snow removal from the side walks as I see many other smaller side roads that have had their side walks cleared. I would think that the city's priority for clearing side walks would be along route 20, Main St, Granger and Lincoln. I understand we have a substantial amount of snow to remove, but again I must remind you that Lincoln Street should be considered a priority over smaller less traveled streets. Please expedite this! Thank you!

After having a short useless conversation with the snow plow operator mid afternoon 2/2/15, I'm guessing that he could not take any comments regarding how he left a mess for both me and my neighbor. I contacted the street division 3 times and they said that they would send a supervisor to come by and see what the problem was, that never happened.On 2/3/15 I then contacted via voice mail the general foreman of streets 4 times and again no response. On 2/4/15 at approximately 8:00am I contacted the general foreman and asked to give me 5 minutes no more or no less of his time to show the photos of the issue. At noon I did not get a reply so I contacted the assistant commissioner of operations via voice mail with the same messages I left to the general foreman. Still no reply as of yet> I am posting only 2 of 16 photos of before and after. The after photo took me 3 hrs to clean up. It was thick and very heavy. This is totally unacceptable. So do I contact the commissioner or the mayor next? All 16 photos will be seen sooner or later by someone with authority.

I reside on the corner of Melrose Avenue and Melrose Street which is somewhat of a valley.  The Street and the Avenue are both on inclines causing cars to slide right back down repeatedly day in and day out.  Throughout the day all you hear is cars getting stuck on the ice/slush, they are sliding into the snow piles at the bottom of the hill due to not being able to properly stop at the bottom of Melrose Street.  My own car was stuck for 3 hours trying to gain enough momentum to make it up either of the hills.  Please salt or sand these two hills before someone gets hurt.  4X4 trucks are fine but those of us that drive sedans have a real issue here.
Insufficient shoveling for safety, and 46 has bushes overhanging what little is shoveled.

issue_type: Snow- Request DPW to Shovel Public Property
issue_description: I'm 9 months pregnant and have to walk with my toddler to daycare and the sidewalk beside Hoyt-Sullivan Park and on the bridge over the train tracks on Central St. beside it are not cleared and very dangerous. With more snow today and even more predicted, please help clear this path.

issue_type: Snow- Request DPW to Shovel Public Property
issue_description: Whene are we going to get a  sender down the street

issue_type: Snow- Request DPW to Shovel Public Property
issue_description: The bike lanes on Somerville Ave are some of the best-cleared bike lanes in the area — congrats!   However, the bike lane in the area where Somerville Ave intersects with Washington needs to be cleared.  It's already a treacherous crossing over to Webster, and having the bike lane suddenly disappear beneath the snow is especially dangerous.
Sidewalk on the Properzi Way side of the Peter Forg factory is not shoveled. Please note, the issue is not on Park Street -- it is on the other end of the property, on the Properzi Way side.
52 Brastow, Porter St. side is not shoveled.

Hello,I have to walk down route one north bound fromup near Polcaris all the way to the walnut street exit to catch the bus to work. It would be nice to have the side walk plowed or at least the shoulder lane so I don't have to walk in the actual highway lane. It's a very scary walk each morning in the dark. And now we're due to get more snow over the weekend. Can we please address this as I'm not the only person that has to make this walk.

The snowbanks at the corner of Jackson and Mountain Ave are extremely high and hard for cars coming down Jackson to see around. Coming down Mountain you are unable to see left or right to tell if there are cars coming down Jackson. There also isn't sidewalk room for pedestrians, so they are forced to walk in the street. The snowbanks extend so far out that it is dangerous for both pedestrians and drivers.
Very poor snow removal on back street between Dartmouth and Claritin
Please remove parking savers from Clark Ave.  City policy is 48 hours after a snow event.  The City Manager sent out a notification that they would be removed per that policy this morning.
The drain on the corner of Everett ave and Broadway is clogged. Its backing up and people are having to walk through the large puddles in the cross walks/handicapped ramps and getting wet.

There is currently no way for pedestrians to get onto the sidewalk without walking to the nearest driveway. This is concerning, especially since this is a well known school bus drop off area. Also, there is no clear path to the MBTA bus stop (Sagamore and Jones) from the corner so pedestrians have to walk on the street. This should not happen since the owner at Sagamore and Jones properly shoveled their sidewalk.

I understand we have had unprecedented snow in the past couple of weeks, however, the area in front of 80 Park Street hasn't been shoveled in any of the recent storms.  All other buildings on that block have a cleared walkway.  With more snow expected next week,  Please have someone look into having the owner take care of this before there's an accident because people having to walk on the street.
Looks like the snow was not shoveled wide enough to let people go through. Since this is a route used by students, it would be best to get it done.
Snow has not been cleared from the sidewalks on Broadway or the park across the police station. Clear ASAP!

Corner of Harris and Quarry large snow pile at end of street (in the street) Harris has been reduced to one lane already.  entrance and Exit onto Quarry is on left hand side of street. Can not see cars entering from quarry near accidents everyday.  Please stop making a snow collection area on the street.. at least move it to the sidewalk

There is a LARGE pothole here that you have no choice to go over at rush hour bc the road isn't wide enough to go around bc of snow and oncoming traffic. I thought both of my tires would be flat just going 2mph over it.

Temple St from Old Worcester Rd to Route 9 needs to be widened.  It is creating a traffic jam.  Cars trying to go right or straight across Route 9 cannot move when cars turning left are backed up.  Normally there is room for 2 cars

Massive Ilegal snow dumping on Mills field by Tocci Management.I Personally witnessed his men and equipment putting over 50 truckloads of snow onto the town park. All other commercial property owners pay contractors to haul the snow away. David Tocci thinks Mills feild is his personal snow dump. Hello,could you please plow reservoir street a little more as it has a lot residual snow from last snow stormandit;s very slippery as you get to the intersection with central st.also, it would be great to lower those snowbanks at the intersection of reservoir and central as well as reservoir and bridge streets

moving truck can't fit down street - moving truck is coming back early this afternoon.

Kids are forced to walk across the main driveway and if this sidewalk from Brookline St to the school was plowed, it would provide a safer way for the kids to walk to the school.

huge snow banks make it difficult to see when pulling out of Fay Lane
recycling was out but not picked up on most of jones ave.  with the snow there is no room to leave it out every day, can you let me know when the truck will be back and I will put it out??

Sidewalks have not been plowed. Also, street snow is still 2-3 feet away from sidewalk in street. Dangerous walking conditions and regardless of how clear we shovel our mailboxes, mail is not able to be delivered to our street side boxes. Just looking for a plow to cut in closer to sidewalk when time is available. Thank you.
Furniture, Trash & Debris left in front of home. Snow removal is needed to gain access for removal of all the trash discarded
Please send a plow truck to Willow Drive in some spots there is three or four inches of snow on the road.
Please send a sander to the hill on Vinton Street. The hill is covered with snow and people cannot get up it. Thanks

HI we are the last house on this dead end street. I am nervous with the upcoming snow that we wont be able to get into our driveway. We have a large mound of snow at the end of the street that is up to our driveway now if the street gets anymore snow it will be pushed to that mound and block our driveway. we are hoping that the mound snow could be remove so that more snow can be pushed to the end of the street. I also know from talking with a neighbor that it would also be nice to have some of the other mounds on the street removed so that when we are shoveling we have a place to shovel to. Thanks stay warm.

Snow banks at the corner of Orchard Hill Road and Salem Street are blocking the view of oncoming traffic.  Pulling out of Orchard Hill to Salem Street is dangerous - there is a curve in the road right before you get to Orchard Hill and you cannot see cars coming at all.  A danger to drivers on both orchard hill and Salem Street.  Please have the snow banks cut down to increase visibility!  This corner is also a bus stop for many kids!

I respectfully request your consideration in seeking additional snow removal from the business district along Purchase Street.  My primary concern is between Merrimac and Hazard St.  Coastline Elderly Services, Inc. is located 1623 and 1664 Purchase St.. As you are aware, Coastline has a large number of employees and older clients that work and visit the building during week day business hours.  I recognize the stress the recent weather has taken on city resources but any relief here would be beneficial to so many and would enhance public safety. Ideally if the snow were remove to the curb along the street and if possible from sidewalks at 1623 and 1664 Purchase Street. I appreciate your service.
People can't walk here because the snow is not cleared. They need to get to the convenience store without walking on Route 9. This is extremely dangerous. I wouldn't want someone to get hit by a car.
I can't walk here because the snow is not cleared. I need to get to the convenience store without walking on Route 9.

Sidewalks all the way up Main Street need to be plowed especially at the crosswalk of Forest street. This is not fair and dangerous that people have to risk their lives walking on Main Street with cars coming at them. Multiple children walking home from school had to walk on the street as well due to the irresponsibility of the Town of Reading.If you can't clear the sidewalks for students to walk home SAFELY cancel school!!! This better be resolved tomorrow so students can walk to and from school. Shame on you people.
several inches of snow entire length of roadway, cars getting stuck each day.
Fist fights breaking out because people can't get through. If you can't clear the street, you need someone to direct traffic at rush hour/

Some of us (like myself) do not have driveways. And those who do, still park on the street. There is a severe lack of parking on Hancock St. It's also getting dangerous because people are parking further into the street do they don't get stuck in snow banks.

English and Allen Sts are two way streets, but are too narrow for cars to pass each other.  Under normal conditions, we manage by ducking in between parked cars to get by each other.    With the snow, this isn't possible, so someone has to back out to the end of the street if cars come from both ends at once.  It took me 10 minutes to get down English St last night as we negotiated this.Would it be possible to make these two streets One Way for the duration?  I'd suggest English be one way from Essex to Derby, and Allen one way from Webb to English.
Snow/Ice between 209 and 211 Jeffeson Avenue by the end of Brooks Street.  Kids walking to school must walk in the street to pass (Very unsafe on this busy street)

Walgreens on Boston St. has not removed the snow from the sidewalk around their property.  Right now, pedestrians have to walk through their parking lot, which is hazardous due to cars pulling in and snow banks blocking views.

Please widen Naples Road for on street parking. Now that the snow piles are soft, a Dump truck or Front end loader would be able to easily peel back the Snow bank for easier road access and On street parking.Thank You

The train station sidewalk is plowed, but when you get to Bridge Street, you have to leap a 4 foot wall of snow to get to the plowed sidewalk on the other side. My son had to make the leap into the cross walk yesterday--super dangerous!

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: Was supposed to be picked up on Wednesday, got phone call that it will be picked up this morning, Thursday.  Still waiting.  Now it is snowing and I will have to put the stuff back in the garage if not picked in soon.
Two buildings haven't cleared sidewalks
The city has issued a no parking ban on street, but there is no attempt at actually cleaning the street.  Unacceptable!
Just came from North St to Jefferson Ave with a stop at the middle school. There is ice and black ice forming all over the city.
Multiple sidewalks along Washington Square and Brown Street are not cleared, forcing pedestrians to walk in the street. It is dangerous for both walkers and drivers. Thanks!

I was told that the walkway along the water on the wharf property is public access and as such is to be kept clear at all times. This might not be an issue if boats weren't occupied by people who live on them, and there are a number. Emergency services would have quite a time getting to any boat there. Perhaps fire could inspect?In the photo, the security door to the marina is ajar. The snow there is up to the top of the railing.

Yesterday 2 plows came up Foster Street to remove the plowed and shoveled snow that was completely blocking the end of Foster St where it intersects with North Street, but they didn't plow Foster st. There are many streets nearby that are down to bare pavement, but the area of Walter, Foster, and Franklin Court have a thick layer of mushy rutted snow that is causing cars to get stuck and fishtail, as well as banks of snow jutting into the streets. No evidence that these streets have been salted or sanded.
Washington Ave and Elm St. have about 3-4 feet of snow on the sidewalks. Can't believe this hasn't been resolved yet. It's been 2 weeks
The residence has not shoveled its sidewalk shoveled.
Several homes on this stretch of Cedar street never shovel their sidewalks. This is a busy street during the commuting hrs and people are forced to walk in the traffic.

Summer street, walking from Malden station, thd 1st part is ok, but as you get to the path near Pearl St Station, there has been no shoveling AT ALL.  The path is just smashed down from people walking on it.  Awful.  Also, all along Salem St no bus stops have street access so everyone must stand on Salem street.  Awful,.  Just awful..

If this street is going to have parking in the winter, the snow should be cleared so they can park against the curb without obstructing traffic. I watched an ambulance try to get through this packed street today and there was no wiggle room for cars to move out of the way, because of the parking situation.

I don't know the exact address, but it between the intersection of Riverside and the Super 88 Market, on Commercial Street. I noticed a young couple walking in the road (Commercial St.) with their little baby in a carrier. This is heartbreaking and super-scary; it would only take a driver's inattention for a moment for them to be hit. Please make sure the sidewalks on Commercial Street are clear.
