The side walk is full  of snow . There is a bus stop here . When kids get dropped off they have to walk on the street wich is a very busy streets during this hours. My daughter saifd that the cras pass to close by them , Please we want our children safe!!!!Thanks
Please remove the snow bank on the corner of Eaton & Beach St.  You can't see if oncoming traffic from Beach St is coming without coming all the way out.  It's unsafe.

This is our fourth complaint with this issue. Conn Street is not wide enough for two-way traffic and parked vehicles. It has become a dangerous situation with the constant trucks, other vehicles, and pedestrians that travel down this road. The snow is at LEAST three feet into the road from the curb in some areas, especially at the entryway of parking lots and driveways, where plows seem to push the snow into mounds that make the situation worse. The mounds are also huge at the intersection at Conn and Fowle Streets, making it difficult for cars who are turning onto either street, because they cannot see oncoming traffic. Sidewalks are not shoveled, either, in many parts, so pedestrians are walking on the extremely narrow roadway. In the small parts where sidewalks are cleared a tiny bit, vehicles are parking their cars on them because there is no room on the street! Currently, the street is at least half covered with slush and ice, because it seems the road is rarely even salted, as well. We understand there has been an overwhelming amount of snow these past few weeks, but it has been almost two weeks since the biggest storm and now we are expecting even more. When we were hit with a big storm two years ago, bobcats and snow removal trucks came to Conn Street almost immediately following. This past month has been far worse and residents in the area have received little to no help from the city. Are we waiting for a pedestrian to get hit and killed, or for a car collision, before we fix this issue? PLEASE send a few snow removal trucks to this area ASAP before someone gets seriously injured or even killed.

The once cleared sidewalks on Montvale Avenue up to Bradford Elementary School have been plowed over in an attempt to make the street wider. Snow from the parking lot has been pushed up onto the  walk way forming an impassable snowbank. There are no safe places for kids to walk.

On Parker St in New Bedford, in-between Chancery & Shawmut. In this one block radius, there are very large piles of snow that need to be removed on the parking side of the street. We have all tried to shovel them down but have know-where to put the snow and it is all turning to ice now. Only one car can fit down this main road and large trucks are getting stuck while turning onto the block on a daily basis. Nobody can shovel out a spot to park because the piles will melt a little bit then the section turns into a sheet of ice. The piles also cause the sidewalks to becomes sheets of ice.I've noticed Front End Loaders all over the city removing piles of snow and was wondering if that can be done on our block too? Seeing as it is more of a main road and it is used by Middle School and High School traffic all week, I am hoping this will be a priority. I've been watching kids struggle to stay on the sidewalk due to the piles of snow and a lot of them end up having to walk in the road. I pray that they don't get hit by a car! I've seen comments from the DPI stating that cleaning up the school areas are the first priority. If that is true then our area should be on that list of priorities since it is one of the busiest main roads to both the middle and high school.  I've already spoken to the neighbors and everyone is willing to move their vehicles so the whole side can be plowed. Thank you for taking the time to read this message. Please let me know ASAP when you can get us some help so we can move vehicles.

the snow bank at the end of church street looking at pleasant street is very high (I understand about the snow) but Im in an SUV and I couldn't even see over it unless I was almost in the lane of on coming traffic. This morning I almost got hit simply because I couldn't see over it and I had to merge out. DPW has done a good job so far with all the snow. this intersection is already really bad.

The Road Base at the dead-end of Farnum St. is in serious need of Repair (In the Spring of course) as year after year of Plowing ALL the snow to the end of the street has ripped up the Asphalt.  The last 30-40 ft of the Asphalt is gone, and the edge where it currently ends is crumbling from the Plows and Salt.  As a result, vehicles that turn around in the dead end get stuck all the time, including the Postman, UPS, and cars that mistakenly come up the street, not realizing it's a dead-end.  Please Repair as soon as the weather permits?

The angle of the corner is hard enough to see around.  Mulitple people in the neighborhood have been in near accidents with the people traveling south on Old Westborough Road while turning out of Sotckwell Farm.  A car slammed into the snow banking avoiding my car trying to take the turn.  Please push back the piles on both sides.  There are no obstacles to do this.

The snow banks at the end of Jay street when turning into Brigham Hill Rd are too high, especially to the left hand side when exiting Jay. Also, there is a fire hydrant at 2 Jay St that is not visible I would dig it out but physically am not able. Thank you for all your hard work.

In front of my house the plow trucks piled all the snow blocking my walkways. They plowed in the sand bucket that the city placed and we physically can not remove the snow. Forrester St is extremely narrow, almost too narrow to pass in the vicinity of #25, and also down near the church.  Large vehicles actually hit the snow banks trying to get around parked cars, which has knocked loose snow into the street and made travel even more difficult.

Constituent reports that entering and exiting Vista Avenue is dangerous because there is not enough room at the end of the street for two cars. Marlborough Road is an extremely busy street and pedestrians and drivers need a clear view to enter and exit.

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: Whole street us picked up but mine was missed, must have not seen it due to the snow.

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: Trash and recycling has NEVER been picked up at the entire section of Pickman St, towards Winter St. The section near Collins Cove before Pleasant St, has gotten plowed, and trucks are able to get through the street in that section, but not here. Since the city has NEVER...yes....NEVER plowed this section of Pickman street, near 3 Pickman, no cars and trucks can get through. It was NOT plowed at all during the January 27th storm when we got over 3 feet of snow. It was NEVER plowed when we got another 20 inches after that.  It remains UNPLOWED, and what little WAS taken off the street is what neighbors were forced to do ON THEIR OWN! I have sent in 10 reports, and even more, to the mayor's office. NONE of my complaints were acknowledged. Trash continues to pile up...8 large bins overflowing outside....and many many many recycable bins remain on top of the snow piles, as no trucks can get through tocome pick them up. With over 2 weeks of complaints, and another big storm this weekend, it will result in contacting the fire department, since this is such a huge safety violation.

This is my 10th report. I have 5 others to the Mayor's office as well. NONE have been ackowledged. I live at 3 Pickman St. This area of Pickman St has NEVER been plowed. That's right....NEVER. When we had that 3 plus feet of snow last January 27th, NO ONE CAME to plow. The ONLY area of Pickman street was was plowed is the area from Collins Cove towards Pleasant St. They stop as soon as they come to the intersection. I called, wrote multiple reports here and to the mayor's office as well as the DPS. Absolutely NONE of them were ackowledged. I kept writing and calling for 2 weeks, since the same happened when we had another 20 incjes on top of that the following week. Again, none of my reports, calls and complaints were ever ackowledged. With another foot of snow coming this weekend, it will result in another week of being ignored. With no one able to get through the street, there has been ZERO trash pickups and ZERO recycable bins collected. I do not own teh property I live at, and must assume the landlord has done nothing to help. That has resulted in rotting trash, piling up to about 8 large overflowing trash sitting outside. It is beyond ridiculous and I intend to inform the fire department, as it is a large problem for breaking safety/violation codes.

Our street has had a abnormally large snow pile since the blizzard last week. This pile is the result of Jefferson Crossing plowing the snow from their side of the street to the residential side. We have tried to remove as much as we can but the pile, which is approximately 8-10 feet wide and 5 feet high, is unmovable by hand and is now frozen. This pile has also caused issues with us being able to enter and exit the house, and a lack of trash pick up for the past two weeks. The spot we cleared to exit the house and place trash has become a parking spot for a non resident for the past week making things even more difficult. Please send some equipment to clean this area up while there are clean up efforts going around the city, and before the next snowfall comes. This is the second time that I have reported this issue with no resolutions. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The 7 - 9 am parking restriction on the odd side of the street near 107 - 109 Loring Ave is usually overlooked by the police, but now with the snow, tickets need to be issued and maybe even towing. Traffic is backing up beyond the forest river because the queue can't form correctly. It's clearly posted and visible multiple times.

We have less than 1/4 tank of oil, and the oil service truck can not get close enough to the house. We live at the end of a dead-end street (Ash St.) and the snow from the two storms has been pushed to the end of the street blocking our driveway and back down the street 25 yards making it impossible for the oil delivery truck to reach us. Cars illegally parked on the street also make it impossible for the delivery truck to reach us. I've shoveled as much as I can but I am 67 and can't do much more or clear enough snow on my own. We've called the DPW to report the problem and the need for a front-end loader and snow removal but we were told it would be a long, long time. Problem is, we are running out of time and oil. Can you help us? Thank you. -- Richard

People keep getting stuck on this one spot in the road in particular. There is a large amount of snow in the middle of the street and all cars bottom out on it. Just in the past 10 minutes I've heard two cars get stuck here.

this is one of many corner houses that only shovels one street. I have a corner house and shovel both streets plus I have a dog and walking him is hard enough without dodging cars

Cars park on this section of sidewalk ALL THE TIME. Currently, the sidewalk has been shoveled but the cleared sidewalk is dead-ended at the car. (I've shown a google street-view to better show the location, but, with the current amount of snow, the car is totally blocking the shoveled sidewalk.)

The sidewalk in front of Salem Prep is untouched. As the lessee of the Emmerton Settlement House, I believe the city is responsible for clearing snow from the sidewalk. Almost all of Derby St's sidewalks are passable, but for this. Thanks.

The snow piles are so high, I can't clear my sidewalks because I can't lift high enough to get the snow clears. hello... I completely understand when the plows go by and block driveways and walkways when they have been shoveled... Light only lets 2 cars go thru on Rte 3 before turning red again to let non-existent car out.  Traffic on Rte 3 is now driving thru the red light in both directions- probably not ideal.

Just seen plow driver back up into a tree, knock down existing snow banks by driving into to them too hard, and going too fast down streets. Very alarming.Vehicle number is E202.

The city placed markers stating that snow removal would be done between 9pm and 7am on Sat/Sun Feb 7/8. Never was done. Street is in deplorable shape, Emergency vehicles will have problems trying to get down the street.
Trash out tonight for Thursday pickup.  It is supposed to be out only the night before ? Especially problematic with the snow.

While I appreciate the historic nature of the snow we've received in recent weeks, and while I appreciate the hard work of the snow crews and other city officials, I'm frustrated by the lack of response to my complaint that the fire hydrant on the corner in front of my building is not only buried, but BROKEN. The plows knocked it out of the ground, which I discovered after hours of digging it out. I reported it here, and was told "DPS is aware of this hydrant issue. Thank you for reporting." That was on January 29th. Today, February 8, the hydrant is still broken, and is now covered with even more snow dumped by the Bobcats cleaning the Blaney Street lot. I called the fire department (non-emergency line) several days ago and was told "We'll add it to the list." What can I do to have this taken seriously? It seems hypocritical to beg residents to dig out hydrants and to make them aware of the dangers of inaccessible hydrants but then completely ignore broken and inaccessible hydrants when they are reported. This is a serious safety issue for anyone in this area. Right now we are just hoping nothing catches fire in any of the five units in our building or in any of the homes and condo buildings surrounding us.

We all did what we were supposed to do, and the has done absolutely nothing. The one ways between Derby and Essex are not even close to be safe. We cannot shovel our sidewalks as there is nowhere to put the snow. So much for the snow removal operations - the city has done nothing bur make the banks on the sides of the road bigger. If neighboring towns can manage to clear things so they are safe why can't Salem Utterly appalled at the response, and the ongoing excuses.
The snow been at the end of Cromwell (dead end) is so large that it is encroaching on my driveway.  A couple more plow passes will block my driveway.  Plow guys here have done a great job!
Sidewalks at this location haven't been shoveled once. The new owners appear to be absentee. Sidewalk is impassable.
Considerable ice from last week's water main break remains at this corner.  It needs to be sanded and salted ASAP.

The only plow that has come down the street today didn't go to the end of the street. We live at the dead end, and the plow stopped 3 houses up from us! Please continue down to the bottom so that those of us at the end of the street aren't plowed in!

We received emails indicating there would be snow removal on our street Friday and then it was moved to Saturday.  And the Salem PD has indicated there is no parking on either side of the street.  No snow has been removed and there is no place to shovel the coming snow except into our parking area.  Will there be snow removal on our street?

I expect to see Russell plowing come and clear up their mess even if the have to use a teaspoon to do it!  Nor only should their payment be held up, but they should be fined.

1 The street has not been adequately plowed before  parking reversals. This has occurred repeatedly this winter. + 2 Timing parking changes for 7-8 am puts drivers on both sides just as school buses are trying to get through. = 3 The last major storm led to school bus delays as some people were late moving their cars & unresponsive at their doors, so people who had complied with the reversal then had to move back to the original side in order for buses to pass and then move them back again after. Today, the school buses simply backed out because they could not pass, and pick-up trucks, SUV's and vans are having a very hard time getting through.Solutions, please: 1) Plow thoroughly BEFORE the reversal happens, even if that means making an additional pass in the morning after DPW comes on duty but before the parking change. 2) Schedule parking changes for later in the morning so that a) fewer cars are in residential areas at that time, and b) school buses have already passed. If either of these steps require changes to DPW staff schedules, then please make that happen -- contracts & schedules should meet Holyoke's residents' needs rather than having 40,000 people trying to meet DPW's needs.I appreciate the hard work of many civil servants, and I understand this has been a particularly bad winter, but the plowing situation (not the snow situation per se) is the worst I've seen in 19 years here, and my neighbors who've been on this block since the 1960's say it's also the worst street clearing they've ever seen here. This needs to be fixed.Please refer to DPW and the Mayor's Office. Thank you.

There is nowhere to be able to park our cars on the street, due to the fact that the plow has left only a path down the center of the street. We would like to be able to park on the street again, if a plow could move some of the snow to enable parking on the even side of Federal St. We have no off street parking, & my husband cannot walk to another spot to park, due to COPD.  We understand the snow problems in all of Salem, but would appreciate being able to get our cars back & available. Our section of Federal St. is not on the list that is designated to have snow removal during the evening hours. Can someone please address this? We cannot keep our cars in the garage, have no way to get out nor get to work, & no place to park 2 vehicles that should be able to be parked on the street. Before this last storm, we were able to at least pull over far enough next to the huge snowbanks & park our cars, so other vehicles could get past.I can send a picture if necessary. However, when we say there is only a plowed 'path' down the center of Federal St, & nowhere to park any cars, that tells the complete story.

There are several houses on N. Washington St that have not cleared the snow from their sidewalks. For those of us who commute on foot, it makes it impossible and extremely dangerous to walk to work. Every day I have to walk in the street. With the Salem Common under snow, we really need residents to clear the path.

Forrester St was impassible when I left for work at 6 am today, due to cars parked all along one side.  I had to go the wrong way up the one way because going the other way was not possible. Until snow is removed, please put a total parking ban in place for Forrester.  There is no way emergency vehicles could make it down.

no side walks shoveled on Summer Street starting at 112 Margin St to Prescott St on either side. It's a major cut through for cars especially the police. People are forced to walk in the street. All residential houses and nothing shoveled either side.

The lower end of Green Street is not clear enough to continue to function as a two way street, nor can Pioneer Terrace which Green Street intersects. This is a cut through street for people from Lafayette Street  on any day - let alone with the traffic now sitting on Lafayette Street and it is also an access point to the drop off area for the Saltonstall school. The snow is so far into the street that people cannot get in and out of their driveways while cars are stopped in both directions on the street for lack of room. No one is parking on the street, even on the side that is legal because they simply can't. Could this area please get placed on a clean-up list?  It would not only make a huge difference for those of us that live on the street it would actually assist traffic flow in the South Salem loop.  Pics are from my window this morning - cars trying to get down the street stopped because other cars were already turned to come up the street. Thank you.
This is a commercial building that never clears it sidewalk - just its driveway and parking lot.  Pedestrians traveling to the parking garage, downtown, and train are forced to walk in the street.

Could a plow make another pass down Pleasant street from the Common to Bridge St? Traffic this morning from school busses, cars, and a few large trucks have driven over the snow banks and filling the street with snow once again. Thank you.
The owner of this building never clears the sidewalks.  People walking from the Common neighborhood to the parking garage, downtown, and train are forced to go out in the street.
Kids are waiting in the street for the bus. They have no where else to stay.
I don't understand why cars are being allowed to park on both sides of Essex St. This is a major entry corridor and it is less than two open lanes in places

Owner of 134 Bridge Street plows his snow onto neighboring properties, sidewalks and roadways.  His parking lot is the only access to 142 Bridge Street, which is highly congested from the snow and tenants of 134 Bridge Street's cars.  A disabled veteran is one of his tenants and is at daily risk of falling on the sheet of ice the parking lot has become.  If there is a fire or other emergency at 142 Bridge Street, the house will be inaccessible for fire/ambulance, which could potentially result in serious injury or death.

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: Hodges Court has not had trash pickup in over 2 weeks. On the snow delay schedule, we should have had pick up yesterday. I saw a garbage truck go down the street next to us so I know they were out. Our street is plowed so that is not a factor.  It is becoming a health issue

this street is used by many children walking to the Parlin, there are snow banks as high as 8ft+ and 5-6ft wide! It's impossible to see little ones while navigating out of driveways! Not to mention the hill is so steep you can't see oncoming traffic going down! Half of the street are occupied by handicapped/disabled owners which the new ordinance does not apply too! Please for the safety of the children & handicapped & disabled could you please help remove some of the snow banks?

95 Pearl St (green house on corner of Bellrock and Pearl) still hasn't shoveled the sidewalk in front of the house. It's  been full of snow, untouched ever since the 1st snow storm we had a couple weeks ago. It's a major safety issue because the kids have to step off the sidewalk and walk on the street to get to the Maddy English school. The streets are slushy and narrow due to the snow banks which makes the issue even worse. This morning a car almost slid into me and my 2 girls. The traffic was gridlock and kids are walking in between cars...it's an accident waiting to happen! l'd like to see code enforcement concentrate on the areas near schools and fine each and every home/business owner who refuses to shovel the sidewalks in front of their property in a timely fashion.
This was the handicap spot in front of my house that I can't  use so my Mom will not be able to go out.  Please come & remove snow from our street Villa Ave, it's a 2 way street.

I live next door and its so gross down their back alley. Right now its probably all covered with snow but I just found this app so I decided to report it. I can't walk past without seeing mounds of garbage like bicycles and wooden scraps and furniture in the side alley behind the house. I am starting to have a mouse problem and I wonder if this is making it worse.

Little kids that go to Parlin School have to go in and out thru those streets and there's no where to park the cars or walk on the sidewalks because people have not shovel at all. It is ridiculous how we have to walk next to the cars carefully because there is no space to walk safely with little kids. And why because these people do not care to clean at all there sidewalks. Also, the parking lot on prospect st next to the park needs to be shovel better.

Could the plow crews please widen up Highland Avenue as much as possible during the next storm, or could the city do parking on one side only?It's an extremely unsafe mix of pedestrians in the road, heavy trucking, partially covered turn lanes, and a very busy thoroughfare. It's only getting worse with each storm.

There have been snow emergencies on Webster street, but no removal of snow to provide places for displaced cars.  People continue to park there after the emergency is lifted but with little space it creates a bottleneck and major traffic issues.  Also there are a great deal of unshoveled sidewalks in this immediate area so people are resorted to walking in the street, which is already very narrow and potentially dangerous.
This is the sidewalk that is on Hartshorn Street
This street needs to be plowed wider. Last night we almost got sideswiped by a city bus because the street is too narrow with the snow banks.
Trying to pick up kids at school is a nightmare on Rich Street (Lafayette).  Really need to have snow removed on both sides of street
Please plow and sand/treat before the next storm on 2/14/15

Could a plow make both ends of Greenleaf street a little more manageable?  It is difficult to make the turn up the street from Clifton because of snow and precarious come down from Glenwood.  Also, Greenleaf itself is a bit slippery.  Thank you!
Side walk needs to be cleared, had to walk child in street to get to school

i live beside him. This is a doctors office who only did from door to street but not sidewalk and not handicap ramp to cross the street. Also problem with his employees and patients parking on maynard st., wrong side ,wrong way , block driveways, park beyond sign that says no parking beyond sign to corner. Also maynard st needs to be widened before next storm people who have no access to driveway can't park on right side (even side) cause not wide enough if they do another car can't get by. Please help!! At wits end with this dr office, his business is on salem st. They should be parking on salem st.
Inclined street with several inches of snow to be plowed. Cars having trouble getting up. 2 elderly couples at end of street. Thank you!
Sidewalk has not been shoveled at all since snow began at end of January.   Sidewalk impassable.  (They plowed  their driveway though).
Still no action to remove snow from sidewalk

Just saw a Malden truck with its plow dropped. Plowing nothing. Why even bother? Second time I have seen a plow doing nothing useful today. Why don't you give them a break or have them focus on widening the streets instead of just pushing around a quarter inch of slush?
I see cars parked on the street getting ticketed. Why? City has not declared snow emergency which means people should be allowed to park on even side. Why ticket then? Malden needs to clear snow.

Highland Ave,  pretty much the entire length, has not been plowed curb to curb, yet cars are still parking on the street, which completely stops the flow of traffic. The morning commute turns the street into a parking lot. The road needs to be plowed better, and parking should not be allowed when it will prohibit traffic flow.

When I got home this afternoon my driveway was filled in with snow and I could barely drive down the driveway to get to my garage. apparently some plows came down the street trying to widen the road and then went into everybody's driveways and ended up filling in the driveways with snow and making the mountains on either side larger and it is impossible to see around to get out into the road. Now I get to spend the better part of my evening shoveling out my driveway and trying to make it so I can actually see when I leave to go into the road.

When driving from Clarke ave to make a left or right onto Riverneck, it is impossible to see traffic from the left, (east), on Riverneck due to Snow pile.need a front end loader to push snow back 25 feet from corner of Clarke down Riverneck, (East). (the same side where the Road sign is).  Please feel free to call me if I have not stated the issue clearly, Horst 978-866-7774.  Thank you

the plows have only cleared one lane on San Mateo and there is no way for two cars to drive at least at the proctor end. Both corners on San Mateo at proctor are so high with snow you have to be on proctor to see if traffic is coming in either direction. The street sign name on that corner is also missing.
Several children wlk in streets to bus stops several children have fallen in streets. Street is very busy and has not been touched since fist storm. Sidewalks need to be a priority!
Please clear the snow from the Lincoln street sidewalks!!!!
The snow plowing was bad, can someone at least put some sand and salt on the road.  With the weather getting colder and more snow is on the way, that is dangerous.

Our Street is still not plowed well.  Can't see the street at all.  I wish that plows would still come to clean up even after the storm has ended.  Can a plow pleae come through to clean up before the next foot of snow on sunday?Thank you!
Husband hard heart attack 3 weeks ago. Always cleared snow from hydrant. Called fire chief today and marked the hydrant. Thank you

I am a 64 yr old arthritic woman. I tried toShovel and snowblow but it was just too muchfor me. I have been snowed in for 3 weeks now and with more snow coming I dont knowWhat I'll do. I also have not been able to get my mail.
Plowers are plowing the street not all the time, just this past snow storm the street wasn't even plow, just not unaccepted

I live 2 houses away from fire hydrant and we shoveled it out, next storm buried it again with dozer and snow is 10 feet out in street and I cannot shovel it out because I have medical issues, can it please be cleaned up?. thank you.
The issue is that the street needs to be plowed.. only car car can get up or down the road..it is a 2 way street

Good evening-The surmountable "snow mountains" on the street make it extremely difficult to navigate. I need help as mulifamily home occupants are shoveling out their many vehicles and stacking the snow in a way that prohibits me to enter and exit the street. I am experiencing trouble getting in and out of my driveway do to the snow mountain located on the opposite side of the road. Please help me.

Good morning.  I am having an issue with the snow plows dumping snow too close to my house on my property.  I understand the plows have no place to put snow however the pile of snow at the corner of North Quincy Street and Pratt Street is less than five feet from my house.  One more big storm and the plow are going to be dumping snow into my house and causing structural damage.  Please let me know what I can do.  I understand there is no place to put it however at the end of Pratt Street there is a huge lot that can handle this snow.  If I do not hear anything within 24 hours then I will be forced to send a formal letter in writing.  Thank you for your time.

Please come and plow our street.  Cars are getting stuck for hours on our street. The mail is not being delivered, trash was not picked up for 2 weeks. It's like the street was NEVER PLOWED!  If an emergency vehicle had to come down the street it would not be able to.

Douglas ave is a dead end street. I know there has been a lot of snow but the dumping at the end of this street has to be addressed and stopped. That 18 foot snow pile is going to melt and flood our basements as well as the street as there is no sewer drainage on Douglas ave. please consider having this mountain moved or melted or something. My neighbors and I unburied the hydrant each and every time Dirienzo plow dumped more and more snow there.  We are in serious need of help on this small dead end street. There is more snow coming and NO MORE ROOM ON DOUGLAS AVE. Thank you

The Snow pile at the end of Douglas ave intersecting with Winter street is partially in the street and is so high that those of us exiting Douglas Ave cannot see to safely turn on to winter street. One has to pull so far out that an accident is inevitable.
The sidewalk is not shoveled between Subway and The Shawarma Place.  The ice-path is very narrow and hard to navigate.
Who is responsible for shoveling this access way to the bike path next to 373 highland ave?

ticket numbers 315484  314542 are 7-9 days old and the trash is still in the street. There are now apx 7 items taking up parking spots that have been their since the first snow fall.  Is there an eta on when the DPW will get to this?
Resident has done a beautiful job of clearing the sidewalk in front of their garage... by putting the snow over the sidewalk.  Sidewalk is completely blocked by 4+ ft high snow bank.
Clearly not even attempted to be shoveled

issue_type: Snow- Request DPW to Shovel Public Property
issue_description: snow falling off the SCAT building is refreezing into a slippery icy walk way along Somerville Ave
Large areas of the sidewalk are still not shoveled between Cambridge town line and laundromat on Somerville ave
Essex and School snow pole still there. Come on this is very dangerous.....
Needs sanding
City plow did not remove snow on intersection of Williams and Victor St.There is a about 6 inches of snow, and many cars have gotten stuck trying to drive over it the past 2 days.

Please have a plow come down victoria & Evans Street prior to the next storm. Also the snow bank on the end of Evans Street needs to be pushed back. We are  having difficulty entering our driveways. Thanks!
People parked in through lane
Disabled senior, needs help with removing snow from second entrance and flat roof over 1 room.
The ice on this building is a public safety hazard.
Requesting shoveling whenever available by the weekend if it stops snowing.
Fire hydrant completely inaccessible due to intersection snow bank. Please truck out of the corner the hydrant is buried as it is right on the corner.

This is for the dumpster between 12 Central Ave and 18 Central Ave (in alleyway). Not sure who's this is, but please ticket the owner. The trash has been piling up for WEEKS and it has not been removed. Up until a day ago, it was overflowing onto the sidewalk. I know its been tough lately for snow but this pile has just gotten ridiculous. The longer it sits, the harder it will be remove. And doesn't help that residents just keep throwing more trash in the pile.Please either ticket or remind building owner to have his trash removed!

I live at 65 Revere Beach Pky. East. My blind driveway is on the Pky.There are no houses from County Rd. to Reynolds Ave. So, none shovels.  I cannot see the traffic when I try tot back out of my driveway because of the snow mounds.The issues are shoveling where none lives, amount of snow on the sidewalks deposited by the plows, and no place to put the snow anymore.It appears that the State is responsible for he Pky.  The plow people  do a great job on the road! But the residents need some help.  Snow removal before the next blizzard would be great.  It is safety issue: firefighters, ambulance gas co, etc would have a difficult time responding to an emergency because of the amount of snow.

We have now missed 2 weeks of trash removal because there is so much snow on the street piled on either side of sidewalk there is absolutely no place to put the garbage cans without blocking the sidewalk or the driveways.  Is there a plan to remove snow on this street sometime?  Last year after the big storm a backhoe came in and removed all the excess snow piled up.  Haven't seen them except in front of the school this year.

The street has been plowed poorly and is now one lane. Most of the right side of the street has no cars parked, can the plow move thus snow to expand the lane? Thus will also allow for garbage trucks to make it to the condo complex.
Sidewalks not cleared.  Pedestrians forced to walk on route 16 with little visibility.

The pile of snow on this corner is hindering a fire truck from making a turn safely. Could you send a piece of equipment to remove some of the snow so we have a place to put it for the next storm. You can put the snow in Polonia park.
Large pile of snow in the road at the corner of King and Highland Street. 3 cars have gotten stuck and the mail truck couldn't get thorugh.

Access from Richard St to Quincy Ave is hindered by enormous snow banks that are impossible to see around in either direction. This is extremely dangerous and can result in serious accidents. In addition, one pass at a time with the plow doesn't really cut it. Residents of Richard St would also benefit from at least one application of sand or ice melt.

After each snowstorm, We have used my snowblower and shovel to clear a path to our neighborhood hydrant. This week someone came by and removed a much wider path. That's great. Unfortunately, they did not clear down to ground level, and they left big chunks of snow in the path that have now turned to ice. We can't even shovel it, let alone get a snowblower in there. So unless someone comes by with some equipment, we will no longer be able to clear it, and it will become a safety issue.   Thanks for addressing this.
Grove Hill Park  has not been fully plowed, especially around the back end of the loop.  It's hard to get in and out of the driveway or to drive down the street in our car.

issue_type: Sight Vision (sight obstructed due to tree or other object)
issue_description: The snow is piled so high it is making it dangerous to get out of Asa Meigs Rd. onto Newtown Rd or across to School St. With more snow coming it would be good to knock that down. Also street signs have been knocked over by the plows.

Was hoping there was someone/thing that could come clear the gigantic mounds left by plows both city and from the bank across the street. It is very dangerous pulling in and out of it and little to no room because of the mounds across from the driveway.  At this point they are solid and I have nowhere to put it even if I could move it. I worry severely with the snow coming this weekend. I tried to keep up with it but the plow mess was too much.

The sidewalk around St. Anne's Credit Union on President Ave has not been cleared. This is hazardous for the kids walking from Durfee and Spencer Borden. I saw a teen almost get hit by a car because they were trying to get through the snow and almost fell into the street

the roads are deplorable, streets are too narrow and there's no place to move over for another vehicle. snow needs to be removed to make room for other storms like R.I. is doing. This is the worst job this city has done.
The sidewalk plow hacked off 3 feet of a pine tree which sits on the property and is clear of the sidewalk. (see photo)

the lower end of Hastings Street is very hard to navigate safely due to several inches of soft snow and snow mounds making it very narrow.  I understand how the side streets are lower in priority, but it seems the lower end of Hastings is lower than most!  Your help and hard work much appreciated.
snow banks so high on Meredith Circle you can't see if anyone is coming when you pull out into Border Road

Plows have piled up an enormous pile of snow at the corner of Bird Street and Rockwood Lane.  It's very dangerous as kids have to go out in the street to get around on the way to school.  This pile needs to be reduced/removed, especially with more snow coming.  Thank you.
Remove snow banks at corners of Stewart Road and Great Plain Avenue.
Resident asked for snow/ice plowed into driveway by the Town be removed.
Please remove snow that Needham DPW snow thrower threw this afternoon blocking previously shoveled front door entrance with a 3 foot high pile of dense snow
still a lot of snow on the ground - hard to drive in
I do not know if there is a scheduled snow removal but if there was 1 pass with the large snow blower should do it.
Reduce size of snow bank southwest corner of West and Hillside. When stopped on Hillside to cross West Street (from south to north), no view down hill to look for oncoming vehicles due to snowbank.
Please remove snow in sidewalk that Town snowthrower placed into his sidewalk 2 times today.

This area is also a sight visibility issue for pick up line.  The gate needs to be unblocked of snow so police/fire have access to the red gate.  Can this be done by Tuesday when they return to school?
Please remove some of snow banks at end of Hazel LN, which are currently too high for cars to see on-coming traffic from either direction on Hunting.
Please remove snow bank at Hillside Ave @ Hunnewell St.  site clearance problem for vehicles
We can't see to pull out onto busy Dedham Ave because the snow banks are so high.  Anything you can do would be greatly appreciated!
Please widen PARISH Rd, single car lane travel due to snow.

Can the snow be moved to where it is not near 9 Melvern?  It's the only house on the street and the snow bank has grown at the end of his driveway and he'd like it pushed 15 feet further away before the next storm.
When street was widen snow was pushed on to sidewalk which blocked access to mailbox. Owner would like snow removed from mailbox and sidewalk.
Snow is blocking the sidewalk at 8 Tudor and Broadmeadow. Kids on their way to school are walking into traffic to get out. Either homeowner or town needs to clear it. It has been this way for 2 days.

I know that the DPW is very busy with snow removal issues, but in the past the DPW has sent their snow blower machine down the north side of Allen St to clear the snow off the sidewalk. It is dangerous for pedestrians to walk in the street. Thank you.

This is the second complaint above the shabby job of plowing that has been done on Glen lane!  The stree is impassable now and with another impending foot of snow coming this weekend we won't even be able to get out of our driveway!  It amazing how many streets ariund us are down to bare pavement so why is ours impassable.  I tried calling the DPW snow phone number listed and no answer, no answering machine.  When Is someone going to do something about this?
There is a fire hydrant somewhere in front of 58 Pine Avenue, but the plows buried it under about 15 feet of snow so it is nearly impossible to locate it much less dig it out.
Can the town please plow Belcher Street?  It has not been plowed since Monday night and is slippery/sloppy with snow.

Like many, street is very narrow from the snow, and could hamper emergency vehicles.  this is especially true turning in from Main St.  With another foot of snow expected, can the street be given some attention??

Reynolds ave is a nightmare to drive down. Two cars got stuck in the snow because nobody could see either vehicle coming around a snow mound and both vehicles did what they could to make room for one of them to get by. Unsure how contract is awarded to the moffords, but for a plow driver too live on the street they plow and not know where the sidewalk is, is unconscionable and money not well spent.

Not sure who was contacted this year but the plowing is awful looks untouched and was and is sloppy at best the mail person is getting stuck!!! Please send someone out to replow We have more snow coming and not alot of places to put it undestandably which is why it needs to be done properly.  Maybe we can get our trash picked up!!
Im almost certain the trash people cant get through because of the lousy sloppy plow job that was done it is deplurable please send someone back there's more snow coming!!!!!
Mine & the other streets in Riverside desperately need snow removal.   There is no access at this point from North Shore due to a large bank of snow blocking the end of the street.
Town trucks cleared snow but dumped it all on the fire hydrant at the bottom of McDevitt Drive.  Impossible to dig out as a home-owner now.
Cannot see to left when pulling out of Hinston on to Wildwood.  Snow piles too high.  Thanks for continuing efforts!

concerned that the sidewalk in front of our house was plowed in again (possibly by neighbor at #16 Kilby)and the sidewalk plow has not been by. It looks like the rest of the street has been done. I realize this is an extreme time for snow removal but if someone could possibly clear it before the next blizzard it would be great.. We have tried but what is there is rock hard.Thank you
The snow banks are so high, you can not see Green St when turning left or right from Nashua. Many MVCs and near MVCs have occurred due to this issue, and will get worse due to Feb 14/15 storm arrival
Snow piles at at Bruno Terrace and Houghton St are so high it is difficult to see when pulling out from Bruno terrace. Please push them back some.  Thank you.

see this, it's still here NO one has done anything to fix this.. Once again Bedford st is & from what I can see will always be a one way one lane street.. Why is this snow barrier still here?? This bldg has elderly & wheelchair bound people in it who at anytime may nerve an ambulance.. There are no cars in the spot so there are no excuses at this point, this ain't right..

Chestnut Street has barely been plowed. The only way to drive is by following another stronger car's tire tracks because there is too much snow on the street to drive normally. The street has been reduced to less than one lane in most places, and the buildup of snow and ice makes it almost impossible to drive. IT IS NOT SAFE. Can this please be dealt with?

2 of the turning lanes at the corner of Church St and Tarklin Hill are completely covered by snow. Another one is half covered. This causes long back ups in this area during the morning and afternoon. Could you please clear out the snow before the next storm comes and makes it and even bigger problem. Thanks

There is entirely way too much snow on the walkway up the ramp to Fish Island and beyond. From Union Street until the actual New Bedford Bridge is almost impassable. It hasn't been touched once since the very first snowfall. Disgustingly not acceptable.
imposible to take turns due to high snow piles blocking view. Also other side streets are blocked to two way travel.
