Snow removal
snow banks are too high on 1st,2nd, 3rd, and 4th ave when you are trying to pull out onto gould rd.  This makes it dangerous being so close to the school.  It is hard for the buses to get around too.

The sidewalks on both sides of Main Street are not easy to walk through due to the large amount of snow and random snow banks obstruct the sidewalk. Just wondering if the town can plow the sidewalks all the way up Main Street. You guys did a great job doing so last week doing so!
Snow was pushed into my mailbox during while pushing back the snow banks on Millbury St.

Please have someone plow our street. We are only able to park on one side of the street on one end of the street. The other end is almost impassable My car has gotten stuck in the street several times.

This is the main entrance to 12 pope street it is a steep hill and curvy the side walk has not been shoveled since the blizzard so you have to walk up hill with blind curves with two way traffic very dangerous put in request to have it done but so far nothing

Ocean ave and Linden St are both high traffic cross streets.  Ocean ave is normally a wide street.  It is now down to an alertating one way.  Many children in the neighborhood have to walk to the Horace Mann school and it is unsafe because you cant see them when they step out behind the snow mounds to cross the streets and the drivers are hugging the snow mounds to get around the parked cars.   When are they going to remove some of the snow to widen the streets to make it safe for the school children.
When trying to turn left from Rockdale onto Marlborough Rd it is impossible to see oncoming cars. Can the corner be lowered or pushed back?
You didn't come and plow the dead end side of Turner off Derby.  You came in on one side at the corner about 25 feet and that's it.

Authorities are doing their best to clear the streets for vehicles, but when walking along the sidewalk – or trying to - every other house has a conscious property owner/landlord that clears sidewalks, and every other house has people that clear a path to their car so only they can get in and out without clearing the path for pedestrians.    And to cross the street at a corner – good luck!   Corner property owners tend to leave walls of ice without any path to allow pedestrians to cross the street, so we double back however much we need to and jump on the street along with cars honking at pedestrians who “should” be on sidewalks.    Nope, it’s no fun for either, drivers or pedestrians.Yes, there are laws that require property owners to clear sidewalks, are they enforced?  Food for thought:  enforcing the law, collecting fines, might be a good source of income for the snow removal efforts, would help pedestrians to be safer walking and allow drivers to focus on driving rather than avoiding hitting pedestrians who have nowhere else to walk.

Landlord and building owner Harvey Linder has not been appropriately maintaining the sidewalk / stairwell in front of his home. Often the work is shoddy. He's only shoveled half of the stairwell allowing snow buildup everywhere else. It's become incredibly dangerous. The vents in the back of the house haven't been cleared either.

It is nearly impossible to access and use the bus stop across from St. Peter's Street on Bridge Street. If my Daughter even manages to get their safely there is nowhere to stand and wait for her bus other than directly in Bridge Street where, as you can see in the last photo, she will be in the path of oncoming traffic. I can't comfortably send her to School under these circumstances. The area on the Jefferson side of Bridge Street at that light needs to be cleared to allow at least a few children to safely wait for the morning bus and safely return later in the afternoon.  I don't understand why the piles of snow on Essex Street that were in no one's way by The Toy Shop, Pamplemousse, Trolley Depot....etc. were nearly completely cleared and hauled away while this bus stop remains buried even after reporting it to the Public Works Department twice.. Thank you.

The lights have been blinking rather than working since the storms started and it's causing too great of a delay getting in/out of the train station. It's also dangerous since the snow hasn't been plowed well there that those coming out of the train station are slipping and risking hitting or being hit by other cars.
Residents need to walk in the St. on busy Boston St. and block the right turning lane because the sidewalk around our new senior center has not been cleared. This is very dangerous

Heavy equipment dump trucks have been using Pleasant St all night on their way back and forth to the willows area removing snow. These big trucks drive over snow banks pushing more snow into the street. It is now as snowy and messy as right after the storm in parts. Please, re-plow the street...no body can get out of their driveways. Thanks.

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: trash was picked up, but cans were left all over roadside.this is the third lid and second can we have had destroyed in the past few months, not counting the one that completely disappeared. today I found my trash can obliterated just a few minutes after north shore emptied it because it was left in grove street and smashed by oncoming traffic. I couldnt even get outside fast enough between them picking up and the can getting nailed.  I understand space is at a premium due to snow, but it seems relatively easy to put a can back from the location it was taken from rather than throwing it wherever it lands. the street is strewn with cans and trash. it seems that buying a new trashcan once a month is the norm?

We've kept the our sidewalks and the hydrant at Bridge & Thorndike perfectly clear throughout every storm. While we appreciate that a bucket loader/dump truck combo removed mounds of snow in the area last night  (2/12), they boxed in the hydrant!

So instead of plowing the street, you decide to close it. You allow cars to park but you can BARELY get by. I watched a school bus get stuck this morning. I try and get back home and you have road closed signs. I hope that means you're going to take care of the issue.
Botts ct has about three inches of snow on the road, doesn't appear to have been plowed lately

Last night was snow removal in our neighborhood. How come they only removed the snow from one side of Boardman but they went curb to curb on Forrester and Briggs? It's great that you can safely drive down Boardman St but you still can not park on it. How long do you expect people not to be able to park where they live?

It is extremely difficult to pull out of driveways on Becket St. due to the narrow, poorly plowed lane and high snow banks. Just this evening, a vehicle was pulling out of a driveway with very limited visibility and another vehicle was unable to stop from sliding into it. Please prioritize clearing this street before the next storm on Saturday night. Thank you very much!

There needs to be snow removal immediately from Loring Ave between Lafayette Street and Canal. The traffic is awful due to the parking on either side of the street. It is also unsafe for parents dropping children off at Horace Mann. We can not find any temporary parking and when we do children are forced to enter cars from the street since the snow banks are 5ft high.

In front of Jefferson. You need to climb a snow bank & walk on street. There is a curve in the road & u cannot see cars coming. The curb on the other side of Bridge & Howard St Ext is also  blocked by at least 8ft of snow.

Once your past the pedestrian bridge that goes to SHS, hardly anything is shoveled, which forces students and pedestrians to walk on the street. My husband was hit by a car walking to the grocery store.  It's a safety issue.

There are great mounds of snow at the "T" corners connecting Forrester and Boardman and throughout the street. Need some help here especially since a blizzard has already been declared for Boston. We have no place to throw it.

This house has been reported before. They have only cleared a path from the front door to the street. The rest of the sidewalk is impassable, making pedestrians walk in the street at a dangerous location. They should be fined again--maybe it will make a difference.

Large pile of snow is blocking the cross walk at the intersection of Federal St. and North St.  There is no safe way for pedestrians to cross this busy intersection without having to step out into the street.

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: I don't think the trucks can turn into Hathorne Place because of the snow banks. Can you send a smaller truck or ask the collectors to walk up the street to get everything, please? Thanks

Several cars have been parked on Endicott St. the past several days, despite the "No parking either side" ban.  Not only does it make it difficult/impossible for the plows to widen the street, it has at times made it almost impossible to pull out of driveways between the high snow banks and cars parked directly behind driveways on the opposite side of the street.

Weds night SPD made owners remove the few cars on on Pleasant St yet no additional plowing has been done. This street is an unofficial shortcut from Bridge to the Common (avoiding Winter St 1A) and gets a LOT of traffic including school buses and this morning, a parade of big dump trucks removing snow. Pleasant/Webster/Spring are a mess. Please re-plow. Thank you.
Ice is very thick on the sidewalk.  Please put sand or salt down.

There are sizable snowbanks where there should be sidewalk on either side of the parking lot entrance for 26 New Derby (which is on Front Street). Forcing people into the street. This is a recurring problem. I'm unsure who is responsible for having them cleared. RCG?
I was almost struck by a truck last night. I was careful to check to make sure no one was coming, however the truck was speeding & came out of no where. This is at a busy intersection.

The owner of the property on the corner of Forest Ave and Lafayette St has not completely shoveled the sidewalk in front of their property on Forest Ave - it is only half done. This forces people to walk on Forest Ave (which is barely passable) which is DANGEROUS. There are small school age children in the area as well as sight impaired folks living on Wisteria St with service dogs.
AWESOME job cleaning Forrester Street last night...Thanks!!!!

The snow has not been cleared at the sidewalk intersection of Lafayette and Ocean in front of the property of the Andrew Michaels Salon. This area has TWO crosswalks and pedestrians cannot get access them. There is also an MBTA bus stop at this corner as well as a crosswalk button and light that no one can access. To get by, one needs to walk on Lafayette St from the church next to this business all the way down Lafayette St until they get to Ocean, then down Ocean Ave until the entrance of this business before one can get on the sidewalk.DANGEROUS

The owner of this property has yet to shovel their sidewalk on either Wisteria St or Forest Ave. Residents, college students and small children going to school in the are forced to walk on both streets. This is dangerous. This resident NEVER clears their sidewalks
The sidewalk at this residence has not been shoveled at all, causing pedestrians to walk in Derby Street

I have spent quite a bit of time in the last 3 weeks keeping the fire hydrant at the corner of Pine and Summer streets clear. The sidewalk snow thrower came by yesterday and buried this hydrant.  I know it's tough dealing with all this snow, and I don't really know the challenges faced with the operation of this machine. This is just a shout out to see if there's any way to be more careful when going by a fire hydrant that has been dug out. Thank you.

I know there are signs up for snow removal but is the parking lot going to have the snow removed also. Last week a small plow or bobcat was in there but nothing was actually done. With this storm on its way I'm nervous I won't be able to get to my car if there's an emergency and I have 4 children.

Lower Lewis Street problems with snow banks so high can't see coming around the corner from Paris st almost head on collisions there.  also if there are cars coming out to pky & your the only one coming into neighborhood you have to back up onto Revere beach Pky which is very dangerous to pedestrians as well as other vehicles. snow banks are so high its impossible to get in & out of neighborhood.  Neighbors are getting hostile not wanting to back all the way back down street etc.  Emergency vehicles won't be able to get into neighborhood if there are more than 1 vehicle waiting to get out of neighborhood. Owners of the cars that shoveled and made some of these snow banks should be fined as they shoveled them onto the streets instead of their property.  Get fined if you shovel snow from your driveway into street same thing snow bank in the street should be fined as well.
Can we please have the parking lot by the park on foster street salted. All the snow has turned into ice making it nearly to impossible to even get out. Thank you.

Hi, This morning a huge city truck that was taking snow from the street where the Madeline English school is and loading it into their truck, hit a huge snow bank on my side of the street causing snow to fall all over my nicely shovelled walkway and now has blocked the sidewalk as well as the corner where the wheelchair access is.  Can someone come clear that path back again, it is filled with ice and packed snow I do not think I can remove it and I do not want to get a ticket or violation for it.  Please help.  thank you!

Two big mounds on the end of the driveway(one of which is blocking a doorway to the house)If  we get more snow we DONT have anywhere to put it, its already over our heads! Actually the whole street is like that!

Last Thursday there were signs not to park any cars on Linden St (the part going down to main st) because of snow removal but nothing happened the signs were removed the next morning but still that street is a mess there's not many more spaces to park or to put any more snow. I understand there is a lot of streets to clean and that the city is trying their best to clean but there is a lot of traffic on this street because it goes down to Main Street. Can you please have them attempt to remove the snow from this street again? We are supposed to get more snow and there's no more space to put it. Thank you!

Summit Ave is a two way side street that is very popular to travel up and down. It is also very narrow.  Currently, there is so much snow on the sidewalks that traveling up and down the street is very difficult.  There is no room to pullover if another vehicle is coming from the opposite direction.  We have run out of places to put the snow.  I understand that the city removal team is doing all that they can but please send services to remove the snow.

I was just wondering when the snow removal was going to take place on Bell Rock Street?  The No Parking signs have bee up for two days and nothing has happened yet.  With the Maddy English school on this street, it's unbelievable that a child or adult has not been hit by a car yet.  You can only fit one car at a time on the street and the drop off and pick up of the children is a disaster.  Thank you.

If your plows are in the area and can assist, Hamilton Street is in dire need of snow removal.  Curb to curb would be terrific...i am sure residents would move their vehicles to make this happen.  Safe passage from Malden Street into Chelsea is a definite challenge for vehicles and almost impossible for walkers.

Can either side of the snow mound (once a little park) in front of the fire station on Hancock and Gilmore Streets be added to the list, too? There are usually spaces for 5 cars on either side and now its down to about 3. Thanks in advance!! :)
Lewis street is suppose to be a 2 way street and 2 cars can't get down the street one person has to back up to let other car by there hasn't been any snow removal on this street at all
Two way traffic on School Street is incredibly difficult because the snow has not been cleared. The parking spaces have not been cleared either so many cars parked on the street are into the road.

The sidewalks aren't completely clear on Liberty Street and Union Street so pedestrians are walking in the street, including children.  In some places, specifically at the intersection, the sidewalks have not been cleared at all. Also both roads have not been completely plowed and the snow banks are incredibly high causing reduced visibility.

Clarence st. coming from Dartmouth st. should really be a one way during school hours. The traffic gets backed up because of cars trying to turn left on to Clarence as cars who are coming down Clarence try to drop their kid/kids off at Webster School. When there is no snow it's parking on both sides and it's hard to pull over to let the car pass and now that there is snow it's even harder.  Last year I was in an accident when I was trying to pick my preschooler up from school cause of a car coming at me fast and wasn't moving over so I had to quickly move and I hit a car. it really honestly is truly a Nightmare during school hours on Clarence St.

The snow banks on the corners of bell rock street and Woodville street are high and wide and it's difficult to see children trying to cross to get to school. Also makes it impossible to safely drop kids off at school without blocking traffic. Thanks!
Private Plow at 521 Broadway dumping snow  from driveway to MBTA bus stop across the street and in the street.

Snow on this street has become a hazard if there was ever an emergency,  no ambulance or fire trucks would not be able to get by, especially on the S turn...plow trucks there best yes but it seems like they are bringing more snow from Holyoke st, that guy from JKA on the corner with the big tractors just makes more of a mess,
Right now this area not wide enough for two cars.   These people throwing snow on the street is only making to worse

Plow just went up and down floral avenue pushing snow across driveways.  Never done to this degree in any storm before and not fair for residents to have to clean his mess. No plate on red plow truck, it was covered with snow.
Two cars parked on the street during a snow emergency impeding snow removal.
Car needs pulling out of snow bank
Assisted living on Broadway did not clear snow on the side street, on shoveled out the front.
please send plow, hill needs plow and sand
Not shoveled, beaten down by pedestrians.
sidewalk never shoveled....this resident almost never shovels
sidewalk was never shoveled
Still not plowed,  3 inches of ice now, with snow on top
Fire hydrant buried.
This residence NEVER clears snow after a storm. It's gotten out of hand.
The town plowing is blocking my driveway. Snow needs to be removed on the dead end where my driveway begins. I can not get out of my driveway due to the snow banks blocking it.

The sidewalks were plowed in front of our house the other day and the snow was piled in the middle of our driveway.  We found this the next morning on our way into work and it was iceburg frozen solid.  We will break our snow blower trying to fix this.  I called on 2/13 at 7:00AM, but this still has not been resolved.  Our cars keep getting stuck in our driveway and we are expecting guest this weekend.  Please fix this issue!!!  We do our best several times each storm to keep our driveway cleared and salted.  Being on a main road we do not have the luxury of having our guest park on a side road.  I appreciate all you have done to keep the roads safe, but this is not something we should have to deal with for days.  We are expecting more snow and unsure how we will snow blow around all of these ice mountains in the middle of our driveway.  I look forward to hearing back on getting help with this matter.

Yet again,  another storm,  another episode of poor street conditions. The group home nearby is having issues transporting it's inhabitants and so aren't many of the people in the neighborhood.  Not everyone owns a truck or a car with snow tires and all wheel drive. I see trucks come up and down the street dropping sparse amounts of sand and salt with their blades up. Scrape the roads and drop some salt and sand, just putting sand on top of snow isn't going to help.

I have always been a fan of the snow removal crews in Brockton. In fact, I was going to write a letter tomorrow, complimenting them on their efficiency and apologizing for a young man who is a guest in our home right now. He was quite rude to a plow driver during one of the recent big storms and I'm very sorry he was so nasty. But then today, midafternoon, there were two large tractor/truck kind of vehicles..yellow. They were back and forth several times and when I went out to clear the end of the driveway after they were gone, I couldn't believe that the mound they left was up to my chin (and I am not short) and several feet deep. My husband is on home dialysis and a respiratory assist device. If something emergent were to happen to him, not only could we not get him out but any emergency personnel trying to do the same would be delayed by that huge mound. It almost has the ring of revenge to it, but I would really hope your drivers don't do that. I'm so disappointed in your staff that I could cry. And I now have several hours' worth of shoveling to make it safe for my husband again.

the tow truck has filled snow in path i made to get out of my house to over 8 ft. i am on a dead end street where this snow could have been put in the empty lot at 15 elm circle. INSTEAD they have also piled the snow over the FIRE HYDRANT.  this is the only one on the street.  i would like help asap

My house is the last house on a dead end street and today the snow plows piled a very very large pile (mound) of snow in front of my front entrance preventing me from leaving or entering my house, please have the snow pile removed. Thank you
i live on a dead end street and the snow plows have blocked my the front entrance nce

i live at 240 Woodard Ave. Im the last  house on the street. And because of that the snow has piled up so much from the plows that i barely can get out of my driveway. Any help with snow removal would be greatly appreciated. Thank you

Throughout the entire street the road is poorly plowed. When I try to back up and drive from my apartment, I have to constantly look out for other cars. Due to the limited vision from the high snowbanks this is an extremely difficult task. I ask that the dpw should pay attention to side streets like mine. They should move the excess snow to more open locations. the streets should be treated more so that cars don't slip. Also, the plows should widen the streets so that cars don't become more cramped.

Burton street is a very small street so with all the snow piled up and cars having to park on the side of the road no cars are able to get through. The school buses need to back up to get off the street.
Glaze ice on sidewalk east side of Curtis behind storefronts at corner of highland ave
Thick and uneven layer of ice on this heavily trafficked section of sidewalk.

A Front End loader is needed to move the snow bank in front of 59 Evergreen St.  After this storm the driveway won't be accessible.  Neighbor has asked to park in my driveway if he can't access his.  Currently he has to back up street and into my driveway to get out of his driveway
Elderly couple in need of assistance. Driveway and stairs need to be shoveled.

The Original Party Trolley Company staff once again think it's ok to shovel snow off their 4 car driveway and onto the street, blocking in shoveled out parking spaces. At least this time they didn't throw it or plow it on top of parked cars. These guys have no respect for their neighbors.

Just wanted to report that there is a car parked in front of 54 Congress that has not been touched since before the first big storm in January. Is now completely encased in a mountain of snow. A snowplow would not know that there is a car underneath. I and most neighbors on our block have been dealing with snow together and checked with each other but we have not been successful in finding vehicle owner. MA registration 159PL7.  Any way to check if the owner lives in Chelsea?  We are starting to cover the car with snow because there is nowhere else to put it.  Thank you DPW for all that you have been doing- the snow is miserable and tempers are frayed.

Boston has a great idea by making some streets one way because of the snow.  Can we do that here too?  We constantly have cars coming over the hill in both directions with no where to pull over.   Today we had a fire engine coming up from Crescent and a plow coming from Eastern on to meet in front of my house.  The plow had to back all the way back down to Eastern Ave.  This is not safe at all.  All the surrounding streets are in the same situation.
Needs to clean up the other side of   the street so more people can park that don't have driveways, the odd side was done Now THE EVEN SIDE NEEDS  TO  BE  DONE . ..thank you
Plow truck needed

This truck has been parked on Butler Road next to Central since Saturday(02/14) afternoon on the odd side of the road. It still was there as of Sunday at 9:00 am. The plow will not be able to plow correctly with it there.
While picking up and dropping off my son to school 2/13 I noticed all fire hydrants at school buried in snow.  Concerned for kIds safety

Hello,My girlfriend and I are having issues with how snow is plowed on our street.  We are both physically limited in our ability to shovel.  With each passing snow storm, it seems the plows dump the majority of the snow directly into our driveway (today's is about 4.5 ft high, and 7 ft. deep in from the road).  Other neighbors around us do not have this issue, and usually have only about a 1 ft. high mound in front of their driveways.  This is making it extremely difficult on the both of us.  We are unable to leave quickly in an emergency situation, or upon returning home, we have to leave our cars in the narrow street while shoveling.   There is a large open grass area directly next to our driveway that the plows could easily dump the snow into.  Could this PLEASE be used instead?  Can this please be addressed?  It is becoming more than a minor inconvenience at this time.

Snow bank at the corner of Brownlea and Old Conn Path is very high and sticks out into OCP. I understand the storm will bring more snow, but that snow bank severely blocks any view of southbound oncoming traffic. VERY DANGEROUS.  Any way someone can at least knock down some of the height off the pile? Thanks. I can send another email with a photo.
Please clear street at end of driveway - town plows have dumped snow at end of driveway and we can not get out
Resident requesting backhoe to remove snow from dead end.
Resident request for snow plowing.
Complaint of private contractor pushing snow off of Castano Ct onto driveways on Hunnewell St.
Can you please remove some of the snow from our driveway. Due to a lack of space in the cul de sac, the snow from the street is plowed up into our driveway. Thank you.

I would like to thank the crew that came yesterday and hauled snow off and widened the street.  They did a great job and even though we have this storm to contend with it will be much easier to get in and out of our street and driveways.

The current situation on Westland Rd. presents a public safety concern.  This dead end street has been so narrowed by high snow banks that vehicles have to back down the street to turn around.  An ambulance or a fire truck would have a difficult time making it down the street and a ladder truck would not be able to access homes on the street.  Several elderly folks reside on this street.  The high snow banks make exiting Westland Rd. onto West St. a real safety concern since a driver cannot see vehicles approaching on West St.  A front end loader would go a long way to resolving this concern.  Thanks.  j.griffin@neu.edu
Needs to be plowed. One way street cannot be accessed from north shore road. Too much snow.

Making temporary one way streets due to snow.  Example: Eaton St should be a temporary one way street.  If someone takes a right off of Hall St and someone is coming down Eaton to get to Vinal St, it is impossible to pass due to the snow banks and cars.  Eaton should be a one way without snow.

There is a car parked on the corner of Malden St and Brenton St that is preventing the snow removal equipment from clearing the corner of the street properly. This is not a public safety issue since there was an instance where a fire truck was unable to make it down the street. The car has been moved since this morning. If there is any way to clear the corner prior to the storm  this evening, it would be appreciate. I would like to thank the city for the great job throughout the last few weeks.

We have been consistently and unnecessarily plowed in by snow plows as they clear Cambridge Rd. My husband and I wait until the roads have been cleared to go out and shovel the driveway, which we have to do by hand, as we have no snowblower. While we appreciate the unusual nature of this season's snowfall and the speed with which the roads are cleared, there have been several plows going by clearing bare pavement - Cambridge Rd has been cleared to past the white line on the edge. Each time we manage to remove the giant snow bank created by the plows at the end of our driveway, several more drive by and push snow back in. On two occasions the passengers in the plows were laughing at my husband as they did so. Is there a way to report specific plows, and if so, to who? We are all doing our best to stay on top of this snow, and this situation makes hard work even harder.
Hyde Ave is a dead end street.  The snow pile at the end of the street needs to be moved back further off the street.  It has gotten so big it is starting to block the driveway, our only wait out.

There is a large snow pile that has been plowed up against our building. It is blocking the street as well as the handicap access to the sidewalk. The lot has been cleared a few times but this pile remains untouched.
Improper street snow removal has left this area a one-way passing lane.  It is doubtful that a Emergency Fire Ladder truck could use the road.
Snow banks at the corner of Orchard hill and salem street need to be cut down.  Turning into salem street is very dangerous!  Already an issue without the snow banks there!  Thank you

There are some people on South Kimball street that did not move there cars off the street last night 2/14/15. Instead they plowed out there own spot on the street, however, by doing this it's created a snow mound that has made it very difficult to drive by. Only one car can fit through at a time and is very dangerous.
Snow removal. A pass through once isn't doing the trick and the priority must be snow removal which will make all other city task easier

I understand there are huge amounts of snow but with all the plowing at the corner of high st and old high st it is impossible to see down the road before pulling out it is a huge hazard can some of it please be removed
Behind Town Hall there is a large tree with branches resting on wires with heavy snow. Across from 59 Whitman Ave and town hall parking lot. The weight could take the wires down.
Push back the snow at this intersection so people can see and cross safely!!!
Push the snow back at the intersection so people can see!!

We require snow removal urgently. The NG did not remove stockpiled snow and the neighborhood is past capacity.The intersection at Pickman and Milk is difficult in a passenger car. Emergency vehicles cannot access our street.

This is actually  a complaint about where the city is dumping snow. I realize we have been getting record snow but today was the second time a plow driver working for the city has decided to push salty snow from the road 30 feet up my driveway and depositing it on my lawn. In the process, the plow also left a large pile of snow right across both doors of my 2 car garage. We live on a small cul de sac. I'm sure there is place for snow around the circle. I wasn't aware that using driveways and private property well off the city road to dump snow was common practice. I'd appreciate it this was the last time.I attached a pic of my driveway where the plow pushed snow through.

We are the last driveway on a dead end street.  The street's worth of snow has been dumped right in front of our driveway, making it impossible to get in or out.  We have attempted to attack the pile with our snowblower, but it is too high and dense for us to clear away.  We need a front loader or backhoe to remove the pile at this point.

The snow has been plowed to the end of the street and pushed up against my house and into my shed.  The pressure from the snow bank is pushing in the wall of my house and the exit/entrance from the basement.   We need the snow moved, not just plowed.
Please come plow in front of 1 Warren Court Street. Not been plowed once yet. Thanks!
Auto shop plowed their drive into the street, cars are getting stuck turning from waters to south mason
Hey there - just a request to plow Gifford Court.  Haven't had a plow yet this storm and we have major drifts at the far end again.  Thanks!

Andover Street is the only street in the neighborhood that has not been plowed. Beckford, Lynn, River and Federal all had at least one plowing in this storm. We have had none. There are senior citizens attempting to shovel the street. Please send a plow. Thank you.
This is your snow storm reminder to come by Griffin Place (just off Federal St) when available. We have a few elderly people back here. Thank you

Our driveway 10 ft wide abuts our house and fence on either side. Every shovel of snow requires walking up shilliaber st to be tossed on piles over 6 feet tall.  Today we observed 2 plows tandem, a small one pushing snow straight, the 2nd larger, pushing all snow on our side packing end of driveway 5 feet high at  the end, snow should be distributed on both sides.  We are over 60 yrs of age, and our property does not allow us to hire a plow to clear driveway - each shovel is hand walked up shillaber st tossed on piles over our head.  The even side of shillaber st has plowed snow 1 foot high. We would like the plow to come back and clear the tall packed end of the driveway when they chose to push all the street snow to our side of the street. Our street is a 2 way street, snow should be distributed.
Allen Street has still been ignored by the plow and street widening crews. There are still high banks and no clear pavement.

No effort has been made this snow season to remove the snow on the sidewalk forcing pedestrians to walk on the street. The senior center is at the end of the street and elderly people like myself are forced to walk on the icy road.

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: Second week in a row.  No trash or recycling pick up!!! It's getting to be like the snow and no place to put it!!

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: Trash is running a day late this week due to snow. Trash pickup is normally Thursday for us, but there was no pick up in this area on Friday either. As of 3 pm Saturday, trash has been picked up on surrounding streets, but Scotia St. was completely skipped over.Recycling was collected as expected  on Friday.

This street should be re-plowed before the storm today. This is an ongoing problem no matter how many calls and reports are made. It needs to have a plan put in place for snow removal on this street immediately.
A disaster waiting to happen turning on and off bridge st. No parking signs but cars still cannot get by. Heavy traffic road. Please plow remove. Thank you

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: I know trash pick up was delayed by one day because of snow so our trash and recycling should have been picked up on Wednesday. It wasn't so I called on Thursday and was told they would get on it.  No pick up on Thursday, no pick up on Friday, and doesn't look like we're getting any on Saturday, either.Northside Carting trucks have been seen going up Bridge St, and Cross St, but not a single one has come down Saunders St.

Several property owners have not cleared the corners all along Lafayette St and pedestrians are walking out into the street, including students. Please urge owners to clear the sidewalk entrances on corners.

Outlook Ave West is a dead end street and our house is at the end.  All of the snow from all of the storms has been plowed to the end of the street in front of our house; the pile is now approximately 50 x 20 x 7 feet.  One car is already blocked in, and if they continue to pile on snow from this weekend's storm our driveway/frontage will be completely blocked.  We need a loader and a dump truck here to remove some of the pile.  At the very least, someone needs to come by to evaluate the situation.
The only reason that I am reporting is that it is at an intersection without a stop sign and with giant walls of snow. It is dangerous because you have to go into the street to cross here.
wheatland st is like a tunnel  snow bankanks are so high   lawrence st is very narrow and so isnt ocean ave w.   almost impossible to be out of arrrrrea

My driveway is at the end of a dead end street. Since we have so much snow, they haven't been plowing it back far enough, and now the huge snow bank is nearly blocking access to my driveway. The city needs to come with a front loader or bobcat to remove some of the pile so I can access my house. I have attempted to remove some with my snowblower, but now the pile is too tall and frozen hard for me to remove on my own.  This next storm will make it impossible for me to gain access to my house. Thank you!!

I have had to back out of the street several times. Only 1 car can pass at a time and the street is a dead end so if one car is leaving the car coming has to back down the length of the street to let them out. Since its a dead end with the woods being at the end couldn't the snow just be pushed into the woods? My minivan has difficulty even driving down since there is still snow even in the middle of the road. Nice job on Memorial Drive!!
Woodville Street is so tight because of the snow banks and traffic backs up because of school drop off and dismissal. Some snow removal would be Greatly appreciated :)
We can't even fit a fire truck down our street let alone any more snow. Please come and remove some soon please. Very dangerous and difficult to get in and out of our homes safely.Thank you
WE NEED HELP ON OUR STREET

This street is very dangerous to drive down from 711.  City of Malden DPW, please take your plow trucks down and run it a couple times.  Too dangerous.  Also people are forced to walk on the street when barely a car can go down this street.  Please advise homeowners to shovel their sidewalks.  Thank you.

The hill up Wiley (from Fellsway E towards Bowers) has a lot of snow on it, making it difficult for cars to make it up without spinning out, fishtailing, etc.  Can a plow / scraper / sander be sent our way?

I walk down this street everyday and many of the homes in this street never shovel their sidewalks. Specially this house's sidewalk, forcing the pediatricians like me to walk on the street which is already dangerous as it is.

issue_type: Snow- Request DPW to Shovel Public Property
issue_description: Please help with some removal of snow banks on Fremont St. In front of North Star Laundry. We have piled as much snow as we can and we are now out of options. I live across from North Star and we cannot see getting out of our driveway. With the traffic created by the laundry business and the school down the street I'm afraid there is going to be an accident. If even just one bank can be removed from the area it would free up some space. The bank in our front yard is a good 9 feet high and the sidewalk banks are probably around 5 feet. When I try to shovel the sidewalk and put it on the bank it goes in the street causing even more mess in the street. I understand these are challenging times but we could really use some help... Like I said - if even just one or two banks to make room. If this cannot be done by the city can you recommend a private contractor we can pay to do it? Thank you.
need assistance shoveling out the fire hydrant

Plow driver pushed snow into my driveway blocking us in. Tried to break it and remove it but am unable to do so. It's a block of ice. We asked him to open driveway and he said, "no". I have to elderly people ages 65 & 72 on the first floor with serious heart conditions. This needs to be cleared up in case of an emergency. It's unfair that we spend countless hours helping the city by clearing out our stairs, walkways and sidewalks for the mail courier and other people and we make sure we don't throw any snow in the streets, as a courtesy to the city and these plow drivers keep blocking the driveway. In serious need if help. Thank you!

Both Linden St. and Holly St. have been put on the no parking list. Where are residents that don''t have off street parking supposed to park now? Why weren't these streets cleared during the last wave of cleanings and why is there still no plan in place to clear them now?

Phelps Street is only one car lane wide. It is a dead end street with two other dead end streets off of it. Please widen the street--there is already a giant snow bank at the end of the street, it can be added to.

This section of sidewalk, running from the intersection of Cross & Pearl streets up to the property line of 3 Cross St., is buried in at least 4ft of snow.  The responsible party needs to be notified and should be fined per the city's sidewalk snow removal policy.  Other property owners have worked hard to keep their sidewalks clear and this portion of sidewalk should be no exception.

STEEP HILLSJust wondering if the town prioritizes the sanding and salting of steep hills in town when it comes to snow storms and afterwards. I live on Glen Road and the hill is quite steep. If it is not aggressively plowed and heavily sanded and salted it becomes impossible to get home. If you try to get home you risk getting stuck in the snowbank requiring a tow truck to free you. That's a $90 fee.Via this report I am asking that the DPW address this concern. Perhaps speaking to the plow driver or contractor assigned to the route that includes Glen Road would help alleviate this problem.It's a real concern when you can't get home or risk damage to your vehicle if you do.The hill needs HEAVY SAND & SALT. Please help those of us who live on the hill. It just requires some extra attention due to the steep grade. Thank you all so much!!!
Please add either side of this little park to your snow removal list. Parking is impossible during snow emergencies and we need these spaces.

WILBUR STREET the 2 way side of it could really use help soon removing some snow banks. It's so hard to drive on without fear of getting stuck or worse hit. There is a track of snow in the middle of the entire street. Cars are getting stuck on this street bc of how much snow has accumulated. Can we please get a plow to clear the snow. You have people working overtime to do their job. So do yours.

I've noticed signs were put for a continued parking ban on the (one way) section of high street about a week and a half ago. It was started by buccis, but never made up any further. Is there a rescheduled date? Cars haven't been parked the top half of high street since before the Juno storm (at least 3 weeks).  This should make it more convenient than other streets to complete some sort of snow removal plan. Our only other options for parking are fighting for a spot on Hampshire or hoping there's parking in the lot near the parlin. I understand the city is busy as is, but please add this to the list of priorities. It is already tight enough and people are still forced to walk in the street. Thank you in advance!

I want to report the abuse of power of Stephen Finocchio from ISD. Earlier today my street was blocked off by police due to the cleaning on Jefferson Ave. I was instructed to park on the corner of Spruce st. and Jefferson ave. by the cop on duty until the cleaning machines were out of the street. When I went to move my car I was ambushed by Stephen Finocchio yelling at me that I had parked on a snow bank and that a city car had hit the back of my car. When I asked him to calm down and do not scream at me I was only got screamed at more he kept insisting that he was ISD and proceeded to take pictures of my car, he did not even allowed me to get full details from the city car. When I asked him to please provide me with his full name and badge number he kept yelling that he didn't need to provide such information and only after I kept insisting he wrote down his name. When I was returning to my house he proceed to continue to harass me by backing his car on Jefferson ave. which is a one way and proceeded to yell at me if I wanted the number to city hall, I asked him to please go away but he only got more aggravated and kept yelling I had to go into my house for him to leave me alone. I was publicly embarrassed and I will not take this abuse of power lightly. I also have a recording of his abuse that I can make public.

The parking lot on vernal. I shoveled all around my car and I come out today and there's a huge mound of snow behind and next to my car. How am I supposed to shovel that. Again, reporting that Hancock is still not passable even for 1 car. From canal to Cabot is still 6" snow down the center of the street and no room for cars coming both ways. There are signs that say Do Not Enter but they are pushed aside. Please send the plow to plow from Cabot to canal. Thanks.

Is there a plan on removing the massive amounts of  snow from our street? I arrived home from work tonight to find there is still 5 inches of slushy snow on our street. We have not been able to park on our street for over 3 weeks now and it's getting rediculous. I am lucky to have a generous neighbor let me park my work truck in her driveway, but it still takes a 27 point turn to be able to park. Not only is this a huge inconvenience,  it is a safety issue as well. Since nothing has been done to combat the speedy drivers cutting up Williams Street, they continue to speed up our street, slipping and sliding. Residents on our street cannot see cars travelling up the street due to these huge mounds of snow blocking the view. Soon there will be an accident from someone creeping out of their driveway and a speeding car... And let's not mention all of the kids in the neighborhood. It's a very dangerous situation.I understand this is a difficult time in the city, but no effort has been made on our street. Even the postman says it's one of the worst streets! Please help get this under control!!!
The corner of Upham and Dearborn is very dangerous. Upham Street is two way and you can't see traffic coming out of street as your entering from Dearborn.

Mound of snow at corner of Clark Street and Highland Avenue (at Dunkin Donuts) is too high and needs to be knocked down. Cannot see cars coming down Highland Avenue as a result. This needs to be addressed as Barnes Road has been made a temporary one-way street, making Clark Street the only (if temporary) legal exit from this neighborhood. It's an accident waiting to happen. Thank you.
This address does not shovel their sidewalk. Inspection Services should ticket this residence.

The backhoe did a great job on the corner of N Pine & Essex, but, unfortunately, the operator was unaware that there is a hydrant next to the light pole.  He dumped a major load onto the hydrant leaving it under a mountain of snow. We have been trying to keep the hydrant exposed, but it is now a job for a machine to remove the mountaintop.  We will be glad to clear the hydrant once it becomes feasible for a shoveler to accomplish.

Just wondering if we could get another pass from a plow?  One came down a bunch on Sunday & it was clear, but the wind blew so much back into the street. There is about 5 inches in the street.  Also wondering if the city will remove the snow?  We were supposed to get snow removal before the last storm, but it never happened.

I think when people hear that the snow emergency is lifted, they dont pay attention to the rest of the info because there are cars parked on streets where there is still a ban and/or people are still going both ways on streets that are temporarily one way.  I dont know what the solution to this is other than to issue tickets.  Any ideas?

Pulling out onto highland ave the view is blocked by a giant snow mound that could be pushed back 10 more feet. The visibility of oncoming traffic is blocked, therefore you are pulling onto highland ave without being seen or being able to see. serious accident waiting to happen

Plows did not finish plowing on our street, leaving big piles of slush and now frozen snow piles that are very hard to drive through without all wheel drive. Part of the road is barley one lane.

High Street needs some snow removal rather than plowing. It is a narrow one way street and the snow banks have created a small path with ice in the middle.  We understand it may not be possible to get street parking back however it is getting increasingly difficult to get in and out of side streets and driveways.  The snowbanks are very high and much of the snow falls back into the street causing people to get stuck and block traffic.

The parking ban is still in effect. There are four cars parked on the odd side by the fork on Forrester making passage difficult and one at the fork sticking out. I just watch a large garbage trick hit the banks to get around them and now the snow is spread into the street.

The section of Federal St where we are located is NOT under the no parking ban. We should be able to get our cars out of the PEM garage & park them on the street again. However, the plows have left only 1 lane & have not removed nor plowed snow to the curbs, so those of us who have no off street parking, still have no place to park our cars. Up until a week ago, the phlows had removed enough snow to permit us to park on the street. Now, it is impossible. It gets expensive & is inconvenient to keep our cars in the city garage. Walking back & forth is hazardess at best. None of the residents on this section of Federal St. understand why thecsnoechas not been plowed closer to the curb to permit us to be able to get our vehicles & park them in front of our homes. Other Salem streets have been or are on a schedule to be plowed. The corner at North & Federal Streets is scheduled to have snow removal overnight tonight. Why is the section of Federal St up to Beckford not being taken care of as well? Again, this part of Federal St is NOT on the no parking list. We need our parking spaces back.

Can the snow be hauled away from Oliver St.? Anymore storms and we won't have any place to put it all. The snow mounds are 6+ ft. high. It's hard to see whether cars are coming or not when coming out of the driveways. Street parking is also limited. Thank you in advance.

What the heck is going on with snow removal?  Every single side street, and many main roads are still a mess. I've been in other local cities, and they've had major snow removal operations underway. Just on my short drive to drop my daughter off this morning, Highland Ave is blocked in many places because of cars parked where snow wasn't properly removed, and there was not a single side street that is functioning as a 2-way street. Both yesterday and today, plows drove down Woodland Rd,  yet only added an in or two in width. The street is now 14 feet wide.  Unacceptable. I've reported many issues on SeeClickFix,  and they've never been addressed to the point that out city is safe for drivers or pedestrians. Why is a city truck out plowing 2 inches of slush on the side of the road when there are feet of snow on either side that need to be removed?
Why doesn't this bank have to clear the sidewalk? It's a dangerous corner as it is and now people have to walk to the street.

I realize you are super busy but since the first blizzard the right turn into Wiley Street from the Fellsway is extremely tight. Would you please remove some of the snow and widen Wiley Street there? I'm afraid of cars entering and exiting Wiley are in danger. Thank you so much

I tried to pull out left onto 3a from Wellman Ave and I have pull into street in order to see if a car is coming..this snow needs to be taken down NOT PLOWED. None of the snow from where cars had parked has been plowed or pushed back to the curb. The bus stop is not even plowed out. The kids are standing in middle of road since the town does not have sidewalks here. Yes the road is plowed but there are still several dangerous situation waiting to happen. I do not care how small Wellman ave is I want to be able to safely pull out onto 3a without getting wiped out!"Wellman Ave. has been plowed four times so far.The DPW/Highway Division continues to work throughout Town to push back snow banks/intersections, to widen roads and to clear sidewalks in each section of Town. (We have 230 miles of road, over 600 roads with approx. 1,200 intersections/corners.) Due to the frequency of storms, significant amount of snow fall we have received, this process gets interrupted when we need to plow during storms. When widening roads, snow may be pushed into resident’s driveways. We have plows following our loaders to clear snow from driveways (approx. 12,000). The DPW/Highway Division thanks you for your patience."

From getting off the Pike, until at least the traffic lights at Lincoln Street, what used to be two same-direction travel lanes is now about 1.5 lanes (full right lane and partial left lane) and two-lane travel is extremely hazardous. Have witnessed several near accidents as cars in the left lane swerve into the right lane to avoid jutting snow banks, or generally travel outside their marked lane due to their lane only being partially cleared for long stretches. Either better plowing or a temporary lane closure is needed to avoid an imminent accident.

Litchfield Street and some other side-streets (eg Antwerp) and cross-streets (eg Ascot, Benson, Cygnet) are narrow under *normal* conditions (parking both sides, one travel lane total) and should be permanent one-ways. Now, especially but not exclusively due to all this snow, they can be nearly impossible to navigate as cars coming from both directions face off with nowhere to go. The city should make these streets temporary one-ways until the snow clears -- and even then, consider making them a network of permanent one-ways.

Lincoln Street is narrow under *normal* conditions. With all this snow, Lincoln is now barely 1.5 lanes wide and two-way travel is dangerous if not impossible at some points. The city really needs to consider plowing Lincoln Street to a full 2 lanes, or making it a temporary one-way.  (In fact, somewhat inexplicably, one end of the street, near Soldiers Field road, already *is* an official one-way exit only, although several feet later it turns two-way again for the remainder of the road...)
Right lane is halfway blocked with snow coming around a turn. This is incredibly dangerous. Please forward this issue to the DCR if necessary to get it cleared ASAP.

Snow plowing on this road has not been done well. After first blizzard, plow did not get here until Thursday evening. During yesterdays storm, waste management was not able to get through, driver called road inaccessible. Postal carrier was not able to get through. UPS has not been able to get through. I understand that we have received a lot of snow in a short amount of time, but this road needs to be plowed and sanded. It is impacting our safety and quality of life.

The city should do their job and stop neglected these streets.

Hello there - we'd like help with the snow removal on our street.  The city plow has only been plowing a strip down the middle of our 2-lane road, leaving 5 feet of unplowed snow at the edge of the road (causing us to pay more for snow removal on our driveways as we have to dig out the street as well as our driveways), reducing our street to a single lane and making it dangerous to enter/exit Wheeling Ave where it meets Main St.We have tried to be understanding because it is obviously a ton of snow, but at this point there is so little left to our road that we are concerned that the snow hasn't been removed - particularly since there is an empty turn around at the dead end of our street where the snow could be pushed, and there is only a ditch on one side of the road for half of Mass Ave.  We would really appreciate your help!

Current Massachusetts law seems to require that I shovel and clear snow from my sidewalk, and I do so. Why should the town come by and dump snow back onto the sidewalk? Are you going to come back and plow it? When I clear my driveway and sidewalk I am always avoid throwing snow into the street.

Hi, thanks for all the hard work the city has been doing with snow removal, and I know that you're receiving a lot of these requests. We were wondering if there's any way that the entrance to Charles Street to/from Main St. could be widened and the street treated more for ice. It's been very difficult coming and going to/from Charles St. and Main Street since the road has become very much 1 lane. We also were hoping that the snow banks along the side of Charles St. where it meets Main Street could be knocked down as they are rather high and it's very hard to see when trying to merge onto Main St. especially. The other place they're really bad if the city could possibly help is on either side of the driveway for 595 Main St. (around the corner, 1st driveway on the left when entering Charles St., next to 6 Charles). The snow banks are extremely high on either side of the driveway and you can't see when pulling out into the road so it's been dangerous, but there's nowhere else to put them and they've been packed up further by the street snow removal. They're also probably contributing to the narrowness of the street at this end unfortunately. Any help is greatly appreciated, thank you!

Good Day,I reside on Mass Ave. in Woburn and am concerned about the safety of traffic within my neighborhood. With all of the snow we've received this winter the street has become much more narrow allowing only one car to pass at a time.  We essentially have to clear about 5 feet of snow at the ends of our driveways that really should be plowed as part of the street. We also need to clear about 5 feet of snow to get to one of the fire hydrants on our road.  The other is completely covered and impossible to get to. Our road is wide enough for two cars and being a dead end, has room at the end for snow to be moved to.  My biggest concern is the entering/exiting from Mass Ave to Wheeling Street and from Wheeling Street onto Rt. 38.  The drifts have become so high, there really is no safe way to see oncoming traffic.  This part of Rt. 38 is challenging on a good day because it is on a curve that drivers speed by, but couple that with not being able to see over piles makes it quite dangerous. Wheeling Street has also been reduced to one lane, making entering/exiting quite challenging.  This is very unsafe since many local drivers speed through Wheeling without thinking of any oncoming traffic from Mass Ave, and the 10 foot snow pile makes it hard to see oncoming traffic from the top of Wheeling.  Please help us in improving safety for our neighborhood. Please let me know if you have any questions or require any additional information.Many thanks!

125 AND 135 chestnut street have not cleared off their sidewalks since storm 1!

First off, I realize that we got unprecedented amounts of snow in a short few weeks. I'm very appreciative to the DPW for all of their long tiring hours of hard work plowing while the storms hit however I'm extremely disappointed and frustrated by how our leaders/managers in city hall have addressed snow removal after the fact especially on some of the most travelled main streets. The last significant snow fall was about a week ago. A week later, Eastern Ave is unacceptable! Broadway is a embarrassing! How is it possible that snow removal on both of these main thorough-ways has still not been done!? The snow was only plowed down the middle of the road. But now there are huge snow banks at least 4-5 feet off the curb. Cars parked on Eastern Ave are sitting half into the flow of traffic. The same applies around the block on Broadway! Where are homeowners/residents expected to park? The way Broadway was plowed (or lack there of) near the creek next to Walgreens is somewhat of a disgrace!?? Because these streets were left how they were, it just adds to the daily traffic gridlock. It's actually sad that no one has still done anything about it!Every other surrounding city (Everett, Malden, Revere, etc) are working day and night to remove the piles of snow on the main roads...to widen the streets so cars can park and not impede on traffic but Chelsea has still not addressed these two main streets. Why??? Does anyone care anymore? Does anyone have pride in Chelsea anymore? Come on guys! We can do better Chelsea!!!

Why is it the entire length of Hancock St has lanes clears of snow but Quincy Ave along the entire length near the Kam Man is basically 1 lane each way still. We don't matter down this end? Side streets intersecting Quincy Ave, like Richard St still have huge banks blocking views to both sides. This is hazardous to driving. It is unacceptable to have gone this long without something being done!

Neighbors and I keep fire hydrant cleared, however, about a week ago a front loader cleaning up the corner buried the hydrant under a 15 feet high pile of snow.  We are unable to move this kind of snow with snow blowers.  We called the Fire Department who stated that someone would be around to check it out - so far, nothing has changed.  Concerned about the amount of snow should there be a fire here, again.  (Fire on Farley last year where this hydrant was needed)Thanks

Currenlty Stevens Rd is only wide enough for one car width. I am concerned that when Pollard MS is back in session this will create issues with Drop off/Pick up. At drop off/pick up parents park on Stevens Rd. Parking on the street with make the rd impassable at this time. Can we either get the snow pushed back or insitute no parking on "either" side of Stevens Rd. until the widening of the road is addressed.
Someone is putting their snow piles at 63 chestnut circle. Resulting in it now being a blind corner
Would it be possible to allow residents to use our old blue recycling bins until the snow recede.families can not reach our large collection barrels. I myself am not able to recycle.

I hope that there will be a plow that comes down Hall and Eaton tonight AND tomorrow.  It's critical before the temperature drops it helps the people who actually live on these streets move about.  I know we're not considered a high traffic area.   Some properties didn't shovel or remove snow on the sidewalks and it makes it tough for our elderly neighbors and children to get off the street.  They're forced to walk in the street and it doesn't help when the road is a sheet of ice.  I'm just asking as a preventive measure.  Please plow and sand these two streets sooner than later.  I don't want to have to call the DPW because both streets are iced over on Monday.  Considering little was done to Hall & Eaton during last storm, I ask for some help in advance. Thank you and whatever can be done is appreciated.

There is a manhole in my driveway that is currently sinking, possibly due to snow and ice. I am afraid to park my car in my driveway or even walk on it. The asphalt driveway is also cracking because it is attached to the manhole. Help us please.
Please remove snow to widen Surrey Rd and Columbus Rd. Only one car can get through at a time. Thank you.

Residents concerns on flooding of Dartmouth Street Brook.  The last few storms residents have been digging a trench for the water to flow into the Brook.  They are no longer able to do so for the plow has blocked what they tried to keep clear. They are afraid of the upcoming storm and  would like someone to dig a trench to allow for rain and melting of snow to enter the Brook instead of backing up into the neighborhood.  Mike Raymond Alderman Ward 6

Hello,  do you have any plans to remove snow and widen Davis street?  The snow banks on the parking side of the street are 3-4 feet away from the curb.  only enough room for 1 car to be on the road.  no way a car can be stopped on road and another car try to get by.  Every time a truck comes down the road (like the trash truck yesterday), they drive through the edge of snow bank and keep putting snow in the road.   The surface has not been cleaned down to the road since before first big snow storm.  Thank you for your time.  Anne

Please remove some of the snow that is in the streets. we cant park on the street due to the over whelming amount of snow the city has plowed into the street. they have not come to move any of it. the snow comes out alot in the street and it is making it hard for us to leave our driveways without hitting snow piles. we can only shovel so much. but now it is solid ice and we would appreciate the snow to be removed. please help before the storm on sunday comes with rain and ice.

issue_type: Missed Trash, Recycling or Yard Waste
issue_description: The holiday week trash pickup was yesterday. Recycling was picked up, but not the trash for all of lower Hanson. It is now snowing.

The sidewalk in front of the Salem Seven store on North Street has not been shoveled since the last storm. You either have to walk on North St or through their parking lot. The parking lot can be dangerous, especially walking onto Osborne Street b/c of cars not being able to see you due to high snow banks.  Please have them remove the snow. Thank you.
The fire hydrant at the corner of Lynn and Andover is buried under snow. Resident says city said they would shovel it out. Has not been done.
Not one single attempt has been made by the city to deal w the sidewalks here in South Salem. The City has a responsibility for a significant section of these walks and has done nothing.
The snow pile at this corner is very high making it difficult to enter Proctor from Hillside. The traffic on Proctor is very fast moving making this a very dangerous corner.

HAZARDOUS CONDITION: When exiting the new Spaulding Road (and Greenview Rd.) onto MacArthur Road, you cannot see any oncoming traffic on MacArthur Road due to the height of the snow piled on both sides of the end of Spaulding Road (and Greenview Rd.) This is at the entrance to the new Wincrest Subdivision. I was nearly involved in a crash at that location earlier today.  Please request DPW to address.

Upper part of Lewis street was cleared by lower end was not. Very difficult for residents and traffic to move.  A two way street has become a one way and there is no where to put it.  It is also difficult to travel on the residential part of Paris Street.
